metadata.title: Complete Biblical Genealogy Database
metadata.coverage: Genesis through Revelation - All Biblical Genealogies
metadata.note: Repaired from corrupted JSON, completed with all missing biblical genealogies, validated structure
metadata.status: Complete - includes all major biblical genealogies from Adam to Jesus and the apostles

sered.name: Sered
sered.bio: Son of Zebulun, founder of the Seredite clan.

elon.name: Elon (Zebulun's son)
elon.bio: Son of Zebulun, founder of the Elonite clan. Distinct from Elon the judge who also came from Zebulun's tribe.

jahleel.name: Jahleel
jahleel.bio: Son of Zebulun, founder of the Jahleelite clan.

joseph.name: Joseph
joseph.bio: Eleventh son of Jacob, firstborn of Rachel. His name means 'may he add.' Beloved by Jacob, given a richly ornamented robe. Dreamed his family would bow to him. Brothers sold him to Midianites for 20 shekels; he was taken to Egypt. Served Potiphar, falsely accused by his wife, imprisoned. Interpreted dreams for Pharaoh's cupbearer and baker, then Pharaoh himself. Made second in command of Egypt at 30. Stored grain during plenty, sold it during famine. Brothers came for food; he tested then revealed himself. Brought Jacob's family to Egypt (70 people). Jacob blessed Joseph's sons Ephraim and Manasseh, crossing his hands. Joseph made brothers swear to carry his bones to Canaan. Lived 110 years. His life pictures Christ—rejected by brothers, exalted, saves his people.

manasseh_joseph.name: Manasseh (Joseph's son)
manasseh_joseph.bio: Firstborn son of Joseph by Asenath (daughter of Egyptian priest). Born in Egypt, his name means 'causing to forget'—Joseph said 'God has made me forget all my trouble.' Though firstborn, Jacob crossed his hands and gave the greater blessing to Ephraim. His tribe split: half settled east of Jordan, half west. The eastern half was first taken into exile by Assyria. Gideon, Jephthah came from Manasseh. King Manasseh of Judah was not from this tribe but from Judah.

machir.name: Machir
machir.bio: Son of Manasseh, founder of Machirite clan. His sons conquered Gilead and Bashan. Moses gave Gilead to Machir's descendants. They were known as fierce warriors. Machir's daughter married Hezron of Judah. During David's exile from Absalom, Machir's descendant provided supplies. The territory east of Jordan became known for Machir's clan.

gilead.name: Gilead (Machir's son)
gilead.bio: Son of Machir, gave his name to the region east of Jordan. Founder of the Gileadite clan. Father of six sons who became clan leaders. The balm of Gilead was famous. Jephthah and Elijah were called Gileadites. Jabesh-gilead remained loyal to Saul's house.

jeezer.name: Jeezer (Abiezer)
jeezer.bio: Son of Gilead, founder of the Jeezerite clan. Gideon came from this clan.

helek.name: Helek
helek.bio: Son of Gilead, founder of the Helekite clan.

asriel.name: Asriel (Gilead's son)
asriel.bio: Son of Gilead, founder of the Asrielite clan.

shechem_gilead.name: Shechem (Gilead's line)
shechem_gilead.bio: Son of Gilead, founder of the Shechemite clan. Distinct from the Canaanite city and the man who violated Dinah.

hepher.name: Hepher (Gilead's son)
hepher.bio: Son of Gilead, founder of the Hepherite clan. Father of Zelophehad who had only daughters—they successfully petitioned Moses for inheritance rights, establishing precedent for daughters to inherit.

zelophehad.name: Zelophehad
zelophehad.bio: Son of Hepher, from Manasseh's tribe. Died in the wilderness leaving no sons, only five daughters. His daughters (Mahlah, Noah, Hoglah, Milcah, Tirzah) boldly approached Moses asking for inheritance rights. Moses consulted God, who granted their request, establishing that daughters could inherit if there were no sons. They were required to marry within their tribe to keep land in Manasseh. Their courage changed inheritance law for Israel.

mahlah.name: Mahlah
mahlah.bio: Eldest daughter of Zelophehad. One of five sisters who successfully petitioned for inheritance rights when their father died without sons. Married within Manasseh's tribe as required.

noah_zelophehad.name: Noah (Zelophehad's daughter)
noah_zelophehad.bio: Daughter of Zelophehad, one of five sisters who received their father's inheritance. Distinct from Noah the ark builder.

hoglah.name: Hoglah
hoglah.bio: Daughter of Zelophehad, one of the five sisters who changed inheritance law in Israel.

milcah_zelophehad.name: Milcah (Zelophehad's daughter)
milcah_zelophehad.bio: Daughter of Zelophehad, one of the five sisters. Distinct from other Milcahs in Scripture.

tirzah.name: Tirzah (Zelophehad's daughter)
tirzah.bio: Youngest daughter of Zelophehad, one of the five sisters. A city in Canaan was later named Tirzah and became capital of northern Israel.

shemida.name: Shemida
shemida.bio: Son of Gilead, founder of the Shemidaite clan.

ephraim.name: Ephraim
ephraim.bio: Second son of Joseph by Asenath. Born in Egypt, his name means 'fruitful'—Joseph said 'God has made me fruitful in the land of my suffering.' Though younger, he received the greater blessing from Jacob, who crossed his hands deliberately despite Joseph's protest. His tribe became powerful, often representing the northern kingdom. Joshua was from Ephraim. The tabernacle was at Shiloh in Ephraim for over 300 years. After the split, Jeroboam made Shechem (Ephraim) his capital. 'Ephraim' often refers to the whole northern kingdom. Blessed to be fruitful but often proud and idolatrous.

shuthelah_ephraim.name: Shuthelah (Ephraim's son)
shuthelah_ephraim.bio: Son of Ephraim, founder of the Shuthelahite clan. Distinct from a later descendant also named Shuthelah.

bered.name: Bered
bered.bio: Descendant of Ephraim in the genealogical line.

tahath_ephraim.name: Tahath (Ephraim's line)
tahath_ephraim.bio: Descendant of Ephraim. There are two men named Tahath in this genealogy.

eleadah.name: Eleadah (Eladah)
eleadah.bio: Descendant of Ephraim, killed by men of Gath when raiding their livestock.

tahath2_ephraim.name: Tahath (second)
tahath2_ephraim.bio: Another descendant of Ephraim with the same name, in the line leading to Joshua.

zabad_ephraim.name: Zabad (Ephraim's line)
zabad_ephraim.bio: Descendant of Ephraim, brother of Shuthelah (the younger). Distinct from other Zabads.

shuthelah2_ephraim.name: Shuthelah (second)
shuthelah2_ephraim.bio: Later descendant of Ephraim with the same name as the earlier Shuthelah. Ancestor of Joshua.

nun.name: Nun
nun.bio: Father of Joshua from the tribe of Ephraim. Little else is known about him except his famous son who succeeded Moses.

joshua.name: Joshua (Yeshua, Hoshea)
joshua.bio: Son of Nun from Ephraim. Moses' assistant and successor as Israel's leader. Original name Hoshea ('salvation'), Moses renamed him Joshua ('the LORD saves'). One of 12 spies; he and Caleb gave good report and were the only adults from Egypt to enter Canaan. Led Israel across Jordan, conquered Jericho and Canaan, divided the land. Rallied Israel: 'As for me and my household, we will serve the LORD.' Renewed covenant at Shechem. Lived 110 years. His name is the Hebrew form of Jesus. His life pictures Christ leading His people into rest.

benjamin.name: Benjamin
benjamin.bio: Twelfth and youngest son of Jacob, second son of Rachel. His name means 'son of my right hand' (Jacob renamed him from Ben-Oni, 'son of my sorrow,' given by dying Rachel). Born near Bethlehem; Rachel died in childbirth. Jacob's favorite after Joseph. Brothers were reluctant to take him to Egypt. Joseph tested them through him. His tribe was smallest but fierce—'a ravenous wolf.' Settled between Judah and Ephraim, including Jerusalem. Ehud, Saul, Jonathan, Esther, Mordecai, and Paul came from Benjamin. Remained loyal to Judah after the kingdom split. Nearly wiped out in civil war over the Levite's concubine.

bela_benjamin.name: Bela (Benjamin's son)
bela_benjamin.bio: Firstborn son of Benjamin, founder of the Belaite clan. Had nine sons. Distinct from Bela son of Beor, king of Edom.

becher.name: Becher (Benjamin's son)
becher.bio: Son of Benjamin, founder of the Bachrite clan. Had nine sons who were heads of families.

ashbel.name: Ashbel
ashbel.bio: Son of Benjamin, founder of the Ashbelite clan.

gera.name: Gera (Benjamin's line)
gera.bio: Son of Benjamin. Several men named Gera appear in Benjamin's genealogy. Ehud the judge and Shimei who cursed David were descendants. The name appears multiple times, suggesting its popularity in Benjamin.

ehud.name: Ehud
ehud.bio: Son of Gera from Benjamin. Second judge of Israel, left-handed. Delivered Israel from Eglon king of Moab who oppressed them 18 years. Made a double-edged sword, strapped it to his right thigh. Told Eglon he had a secret message, then stabbed him; the fat closed over the blade. Escaped, rallied Israel, seized Jordan fords, killed 10,000 Moabites. The land had peace 80 years. His left-handedness was an advantage.

naaman_benjamin.name: Naaman (Benjamin's line)
naaman_benjamin.bio: Son of Benjamin, founder of the Naamite clan. Distinct from Naaman the Syrian commander.

ehi.name: Ehi (Ahiram)
ehi.bio: Son of Benjamin, founder of the Ahiramite clan. Also called Ahiram.

rosh.name: Rosh
rosh.bio: Son of Benjamin listed in Genesis. Not mentioned in later genealogies; may have died without descendants.

muppim.name: Muppim (Shephupham)
muppim.bio: Son of Benjamin, founder of the Shuphamite clan. Also called Shephupham, Shuppim, and Shupham.

huppim.name: Huppim (Hupham)
huppim.bio: Son of Benjamin, founder of the Huphamite clan. Also called Hupham.

ard.name: Ard (Addar)
ard.bio: Son of Benjamin, founder of the Ardite clan. Also appears as Addar in some genealogies.

saul.name: Saul
saul.bio: Son of Kish from Benjamin, first king of Israel. Tall, handsome, reluctant leader. Anointed by Samuel after people demanded a king. Initially humble and successful, defeating Ammonites, Philistines, other enemies. Disobeyed God by not completely destroying Amalekites and their plunder, making excuse that people wanted to sacrifice. Samuel declared 'to obey is better than sacrifice' and told him the kingdom would be taken. David was anointed as his successor. Saul became jealous, repeatedly tried to kill David. Consulted a medium at Endor (forbidden). Wounded in battle with Philistines on Mount Gilboa, fell on his own sword. His reign showed the failure of man's choice vs. God's choice (David). Reigned 42 years.

jonathan.name: Jonathan
jonathan.bio: Son of Saul, prince of Israel. Valiant warrior who defeated Philistine garrison at Geba. With only his armor-bearer, attacked Philistine outpost, killing 20 men, causing panic—God gave Israel victory. Nearly executed by Saul for tasting honey, unaware of Saul's rash oath. Made covenant with David, loved him as himself. Gave David his robe, armor, sword. Repeatedly defended David to Saul. Warned David of danger, helping him escape. Their friendship is Scripture's greatest example of loyal friendship. Died with Saul and two brothers at Mount Gilboa. David lamented: 'I grieve for you, Jonathan my brother; you were very dear to me. Your love for me was wonderful, more wonderful than that of women.' His son Mephibosheth was cared for by David.

mephibosheth.name: Mephibosheth (Merib-Baal)
mephibosheth.bio: Son of Jonathan, grandson of Saul. Was 5 when Saul and Jonathan died; his nurse dropped him fleeing the news, crippling both feet. Also called Merib-Baal. Lived in Lo Debar in obscurity. David sought him to show kindness for Jonathan's sake. Restored all Saul's land, ate at David's table like a son. His servant Ziba slandered him during Absalom's rebellion, but Mephibosheth remained loyal. He didn't groom himself the whole time David was exiled. When David returned, he divided the land between Mephibosheth and Ziba, though Mephibosheth said Ziba could have it all—he was just glad David returned safely. His son was Mica.

mica.name: Mica (Mephibosheth's son)
mica.bio: Son of Mephibosheth, great-grandson of Saul. Had four sons who continued Saul's line. Also called Micah.

ishvi_saul.name: Ishvi (Ish-Bosheth, Esh-Baal)
ishvi_saul.bio: Son of Saul. Called by three names: Ishvi, Ish-Bosheth ('man of shame'), and Esh-Baal. After Saul's death, Abner made him king over Israel at 40 while David ruled Judah. Reigned 2 years. Weak ruler dominated by Abner. When he accused Abner over Saul's concubine, Abner defected to David. Two of Ish-Bosheth's own officers, Recab and Baanah, murdered him in his bed, cut off his head, brought it to David. David had them executed for killing an innocent man. With his death, all Israel accepted David as king.

amaziah.name: Amaziah (Judah)
amaziah.bio: Son of Joash, eleventh king of Judah. Became king at 25 and reigned 29 years in Jerusalem. Did what was right in the eyes of the LORD, though not wholeheartedly. Executed his father’s assassins but spared their children according to the Law of Moses. Raised a strong army and defeated Edom, renaming Sela to Joktheel. However, after victory, he brought back Edomite idols and worshiped them. Ignoring prophetic warning, he provoked King Jehoash of Israel and was defeated; Jerusalem’s wall was broken down and temple treasures seized. Later conspired against, he fled to Lachish, where he was killed. Buried in Jerusalem with his fathers.

azariah_uzziah.name: Azariah (Uzziah)
azariah_uzziah.bio: Son of Amaziah, twelfth king of Judah. Known both as Azariah and Uzziah. Became king at 16, reigned 52 years. Did right in the LORD's eyes. Sought God during Zechariah the prophet's life and God gave him success. Defeated Philistines, Arabs, and Meunites. Built towers, dug cisterns, had a large army. Famous throughout the region. But when strong, his pride led to destruction—he entered the temple to burn incense (reserved for priests). When confronted by 80 priests, he became angry, and God struck him with leprosy on his forehead. He remained leprous until death, living in isolation while his son Jotham governed.

jotham.name: Jotham
jotham.bio: Son of Uzziah, thirteenth king of Judah. Became co-regent while his father had leprosy, then sole king at 25, reigning 16 years. Did right in the LORD's eyes but the people still acted corruptly. Built the Upper Gate of the temple, did extensive building on the wall and in cities. Grew powerful because he walked steadfastly before the LORD. Defeated the Ammonites and received tribute. Isaiah, Hosea, and Micah prophesied during his time. Unlike his father, he did not presume to enter the temple.

ahaz.name: Ahaz
ahaz.bio: Son of Jotham, fourteenth king of Judah. Became king at 20, reigned 16 years. Did not do right like David; walked in ways of Israel's kings. Made cast images for Baals, burned incense in high places, even sacrificed his sons in fire. When attacked by Aram and Israel, he sought help from Assyria instead of God, giving temple and palace treasures. Assyria came but gave trouble, not help. He shut temple doors, set up altars on every Jerusalem corner and in every Judah town. Cut up temple furnishings. Extremely unfaithful in his distress. Not buried in the royal tombs. Isaiah confronted him; he refused to ask God for a sign.

hezekiah.name: Hezekiah
hezekiah.bio: Son of Ahaz, fifteenth king of Judah. Became king at 25, reigned 29 years. One of Judah's greatest kings who 'trusted in the LORD...so that there was none like him among all the kings of Judah after him, nor among those before him.' In his first month, reopened and cleansed the temple, restored worship, celebrated Passover on grand scale. Broke sacred stones, cut down Asherah poles, destroyed bronze serpent Moses made (as people worshiped it). Rebelled against Assyria. When Sennacherib invaded, Hezekiah prayed; God sent an angel killing 185,000 Assyrians overnight. God added 15 years to his life after illness, showing the sun's shadow going backward as a sign. Received envoys from Babylon, showing them all his treasures—Isaiah prophesied Babylon would take it all. Built water tunnel. Father of wicked Manasseh.

manasseh.name: Manasseh
manasseh.bio: Son of Hezekiah, sixteenth king of Judah. Became king at 12, reigned 55 years (longest of any Judean king). Most wicked king: rebuilt high places his father destroyed, erected altars to Baal, made Asherah pole, worshiped starry hosts, built altars in the temple, sacrificed his sons in fire, practiced sorcery and divination, consulted mediums, set carved image in the temple. Led Judah to do more evil than the nations God destroyed. Shed much innocent blood, filling Jerusalem. God sent Assyrians who captured him with hooks, bound him in bronze, took him to Babylon. There he humbled himself and prayed; God heard and brought him back. He then removed foreign gods, repaired the altar. Too late—the damage was done; God determined to exile Judah. His evil made the exile inevitable.

amon.name: Amon
amon.bio: Son of Manasseh, seventeenth king of Judah. Became king at 22, reigned only 2 years. Did evil like his father Manasseh—worshiped and offered sacrifices to all the idols Manasseh had made. But unlike his father, he did not humble himself before the LORD; instead, Amon increased his guilt. His officials conspired against him and assassinated him in his palace. The people of the land then executed the conspirators and made his son Josiah king.

josiah.name: Josiah
josiah.bio: Son of Amon, eighteenth king of Judah. Became king at 8, reigned 31 years. One of Judah's greatest kings who 'did right...walking in all the way of David.' At 16, began to seek God; at 20, began purging high places, Asherah poles, idols. At 26, repaired the temple—priest Hilkiah found the Book of the Law. When read to Josiah, he tore his robes, realizing how far Judah had strayed. Prophetess Huldah prophesied judgment but said Josiah would die in peace. He renewed the covenant, celebrated greatest Passover since Samuel, removed mediums, household gods, and all abominations. 'Before him there was no king like him who turned to the LORD with all his heart...nor did any like him arise after him.' Tragically, he fought Pharaoh Neco at Megiddo despite warning, was mortally wounded, and died. All Judah mourned. Jeremiah wrote laments for him.

johanan_josiah.name: Johanan (Josiah's son)
johanan_josiah.bio: Firstborn son of Josiah. Nothing else is known about him; he did not reign, suggesting he died young or was passed over.

jehoiakim.name: Jehoiakim (Eliakim)
jehoiakim.bio: Son of Josiah, nineteenth king of Judah. Original name Eliakim, renamed by Pharaoh Neco who made him king at 25 (reigned 11 years) after deposing his brother Jehoahaz. Did evil. Became Nebuchadnezzar's vassal for 3 years, then rebelled. Oppressed people with forced labor to build his palace. When Jeremiah's scroll was read, he cut it up and burned it, showing contempt for God's word. Jeremiah prophesied he would have no one on David's throne and his body would be exposed. He died (possibly violently) and was buried with a donkey's burial. Left the kingdom in ruins for his son.

jehoiachin.name: Jehoiachin (Jeconiah, Coniah)
jehoiachin.bio: Son of Jehoiakim, twentieth king of Judah. Also called Jeconiah and Coniah. Became king at 18, reigned 3 months. Did evil. Nebuchadnezzar besieged Jerusalem. Jehoiachin surrendered with his family. Taken to Babylon with nobles, warriors, craftsmen—10,000 captives. Only the poorest remained. Imprisoned 37 years until Evil-Merodach released him and gave him honor. Jeremiah cursed him: none of his descendants would prosper on David's throne. This created a legal problem for the Messiah being David's descendant, resolved by Jesus being Joseph's legal son (through Jeconiah's line) but Mary's biological son (through Nathan's line).

shealtiel.name: Shealtiel (Salathiel)
shealtiel.bio: Son of Jehoiachin, born in Babylonian exile. Also called Salathiel. Father (or possibly uncle) of Zerubbabel. The line from David to Christ continues through him despite his father's curse, showing God's sovereignty in preserving the messianic line even through judgment.

zerubbabel.name: Zerubbabel
zerubbabel.bio: Son of Shealtiel (or possibly Pedaiah, Shealtiel's brother), grandson of Jehoiachin. Governor of Judah who led first return from Babylonian exile with High Priest Jeshua (Joshua). Laid foundation of second temple despite opposition. When work stopped due to opposition, prophets Haggai and Zechariah encouraged him. Completed the temple in 516 BC. Called God's 'signet ring,' reversing the curse on his grandfather Jeconiah. His name means 'seed of Babylon.' A remnant of David's royal line, he led the restoration. Some see him as a type of Christ. Both Matthew and Luke trace Jesus' genealogy through him, though through different sons.

abiud.name: Abiud
abiud.bio: Son of Zerubbabel. Ancestor of Jesus through the royal line recorded in Matthew’s genealogy. Continued the Davidic lineage after the Babylonian exile.

eliakim_nt.name: Eliakim
eliakim_nt.bio: Son of Abiud, ancestor of Jesus Christ in the royal line preserved through Matthew’s genealogy.

azor.name: Azor
azor.bio: Son of Eliakim, part of the Davidic line between the exile and Christ.

zadok_nt.name: Zadok
zadok_nt.bio: Son of Azor, descendant of David through Solomon. Ancestor of Jesus Christ.

achim.name: Achim
achim.bio: Son of Zadok, ancestor of Jesus Christ.

eliud.name: Eliud
eliud.bio: Son of Achim, ancestor of Jesus Christ.

eleazar_nt.name: Eleazar
eleazar_nt.bio: Son of Eliud, ancestor of Jesus Christ.

matthan.name: Matthan
matthan.bio: Son of Eleazar, ancestor of Jesus Christ.

jacob_nt.name: Jacob
jacob_nt.bio: Son of Matthan, father of Joseph, the legal father of Jesus Christ.

joseph_nt.name: Joseph
joseph_nt.bio: Husband of Mary, legal father of Jesus Christ. A righteous man who obeyed God’s commands revealed through dreams, protecting Mary and the Christ Child.

meshullam_zerubbabel.name: Meshullam (Zerubbabel's line)
meshullam_zerubbabel.bio: Son of Zerubbabel. One of seven children listed.

hananiah_zerubbabel.name: Hananiah (Zerubbabel's line)
hananiah_zerubbabel.bio: Son of Zerubbabel. His descendants are traced for several more generations in 1 Chronicles.

shelomith.name: Shelomith (Zerubbabel's daughter)
shelomith.bio: Daughter of Zerubbabel, sister to his sons.

berekiah.name: Berekiah (Zerubbabel's son)
berekiah.bio: Son of Zerubbabel. Distinct from other Berekiahs in Scripture.

jushabhesed.name: Jushab-Hesed
jushabhesed.bio: Son of Zerubbabel. His name means 'mercy is restored.'

zedekiah.name: Zedekiah (Mattaniah)
zedekiah.bio: Son of Josiah, twenty-first and last king of Judah. Original name Mattaniah, renamed by Nebuchadnezzar who made him king at 21 (reigned 11 years). Did evil. Rebelled against Babylon despite Jeremiah's warnings. Babylon besieged Jerusalem 2.5 years; the city fell. Zedekiah fled but was captured near Jericho. His sons were killed before his eyes, then his eyes were gouged out. He was bound in bronze chains and taken to Babylon where he died in prison. With him, the kingdom of Judah ended. Jerusalem and the temple were destroyed. The people were exiled. He was weak and did not heed Jeremiah, sealing Judah's fate.

dan.name: Dan
dan.bio: Fifth son of Jacob by Bilhah (Rachel's servant). His name means 'judge' or 'he judged.' Rachel named him saying 'God has vindicated me.' Father of one son. His tribe settled in the north (originally allotted territory in the south but migrated). Jacob's blessing called him 'a serpent by the roadside.' Samson came from Dan's tribe. Later associated with idolatry, setting up golden calf at Dan. Omitted from some lists in Revelation, possibly due to later idolatry.

hushim.name: Hushim (Shuham)
hushim.bio: Only named son of Dan, founder of the Shuhamite clan. Also called Shuham.

naphtali.name: Naphtali
naphtali.bio: Sixth son of Jacob by Bilhah (Rachel's servant). His name means 'my struggle.' Rachel named him saying 'I have had a great struggle with my sister, and I have won.' Father of four sons. His tribe settled in northern Galilee, beautiful and fertile land. Jacob's blessing called him 'a doe set free.' Deborah and Barak were from this tribe. Much of Jesus' ministry was in Naphtali's territory, fulfilling Isaiah's prophecy about Galilee.

jahzeel.name: Jahzeel (Jahziel)
jahzeel.bio: Son of Naphtali, founder of the Jahzeelite clan.

guni.name: Guni (Naphtali's line)
guni.bio: Son of Naphtali, founder of the Gunite clan.

jezer.name: Jezer
jezer.bio: Son of Naphtali, founder of the Jezerite clan.

shillem.name: Shillem (Shallum)
shillem.bio: Son of Naphtali, founder of the Shillemite clan.

gad.name: Gad
gad.bio: Seventh son of Jacob by Zilpah (Leah's servant). His name means 'good fortune.' Leah named him saying 'What good fortune!' Father of seven sons. His tribe was known for warriors—they were 'brave warriors ready for battle.' Settled east of the Jordan. Jacob's blessing said 'Raiders will raid him, but he will raid at their heels.' Moses blessed them as lions. Elijah was from Gad's territory.

ziphion.name: Ziphion (Zephon)
ziphion.bio: Son of Gad, founder of the Zephonite clan.

haggi.name: Haggi
haggi.bio: Son of Gad, founder of the Haggite clan.

shuni.name: Shuni
shuni.bio: Son of Gad, founder of the Shunite clan.

ezbon.name: Ezbon (Ozni)
ezbon.bio: Son of Gad, founder of the Oznite clan. Also called Ozni.

eri.name: Eri
eri.bio: Son of Gad, founder of the Erite clan.

arodi.name: Arodi (Arod)
arodi.bio: Son of Gad, founder of the Arodite clan.

areli.name: Areli
areli.bio: Son of Gad, founder of the Arelite clan.

asher.name: Asher
asher.bio: Eighth son of Jacob by Zilpah (Leah's servant). His name means 'happy' or 'blessed.' Leah said 'How happy I am! The women will call me happy.' Father of four sons and one daughter. His tribe received fertile coastal land known for olive oil. Jacob's blessing: 'His food will be rich; he will provide delicacies fit for a king.' Moses blessed them with security and strength. The prophetess Anna who recognized baby Jesus was from Asher.

imnah.name: Imnah (Jimna)
imnah.bio: Son of Asher, founder of the Imnite clan.

ishvah.name: Ishvah (Isuah)
ishvah.bio: Son of Asher. His clan is not mentioned in later lists.

ishvi.name: Ishvi (Isui)
ishvi.bio: Son of Asher, founder of the Ishvite clan.

beriah.name: Beriah (Asher's line)
beriah.bio: Son of Asher, founder of the Beriite clan. Father of Heber and Malchiel.

heber_beriah.name: Heber (Beriah's son)
heber_beriah.bio: Son of Beriah, grandson of Asher. Founder of the Heberite clan.

malchiel.name: Malchiel
malchiel.bio: Son of Beriah, grandson of Asher. Founder of the Malchielite clan. Father of Birzaith.

serah.name: Serah
serah.bio: Daughter of Asher, sister of his four sons. One of the few women mentioned in the tribal genealogies. Tradition says she lived a very long life and was among those who entered Egypt with Jacob and later left in the Exodus.

issachar.name: Issachar
issachar.bio: Ninth son of Jacob by Leah (her fifth son). His name connects to 'reward' or 'wages.' Born after Leah gave her servant Zilpah to Jacob. Father of four sons. His tribe received fertile land in the Jezreel Valley. Jacob's blessing called him 'a rawboned donkey' who 'saw that a resting place was good... and bent his shoulder to the burden.' Known for understanding the times. Deborah called them for battle. King Baasha came from this tribe.

tola_issachar.name: Tola (Issachar's line)
tola_issachar.bio: Son of Issachar, founder of the Tolaite clan. Not to be confused with Tola the judge who came from this clan.

puvah.name: Puvah (Puah, Pua)
puvah.bio: Son of Issachar, founder of the Punite clan. Also called Puah.

job_issachar.name: Job (Issachar's line)
job_issachar.bio: Son of Issachar (also called Jashub), founder of the Jashubite clan. Distinct from Job of Uz.

shimron.name: Shimron (Issachar's son)
shimron.bio: Son of Issachar, founder of the Shimronite clan.

zebulun.name: Zebulun
zebulun.bio: Tenth son of Jacob by Leah (her sixth son). His name means 'honor' or 'dwelling.' Leah said 'God has presented me with a precious gift. This time my husband will treat me with honor.' Father of three sons. His tribe received land from the Mediterranean to the Sea of Galilee. Jacob's blessing spoke of dwelling by seashore and ships. Moses blessed them for prosperity in trade. Zebulun and Naphtali risked their lives in Deborah's battle. Jesus grew up in Zebulun's territory, fulfilling Isaiah's prophecy.

nahshon.name: Nahshon
nahshon.bio: Son of Amminadab, leader of the tribe of Judah during the wilderness wanderings. Brother of Elisheba (Aaron's wife), making him Aaron's brother-in-law. His tribe presented the first offering at the dedication of the tabernacle. Led Judah's division in the march through the wilderness. Ancestor of David and Christ.

salmon.name: Salmon (Salma)
salmon.bio: Son of Nahshon, married Rahab the harlot from Jericho. Father of Boaz. By marrying Rahab, he brought a Gentile convert into the line of the Messiah, foreshadowing the gospel's reach to all nations. Some traditions hold he was one of the spies Joshua sent to Jericho.

boaz.name: Boaz
boaz.bio: Son of Salmon and Rahab, wealthy landowner in Bethlehem from Judah's tribe. A man of noble character who showed great kindness to Ruth the Moabite widow. As kinsman-redeemer, he married Ruth after a nearer relative declined. His actions picture Christ as our Redeemer. Father of Obed, grandfather of Jesse, great-grandfather of David. His name means 'in him is strength.'

ruth.name: Ruth
ruth.bio: A Moabite widow who showed faith and loyalty to Naomi. Redeemed by Boaz, she became the great-grandmother of King David.

obed.name: Obed
obed.bio: Son of Boaz and Ruth, father of Jesse, grandfather of David. The women of Bethlehem said to Naomi that he would be 'a restorer of life and a nourisher of your old age.' His birth brought joy after tragedy. Through him the line of David continued, bringing both Ruth the Moabite and Rahab the Canaanite into the messianic lineage.

jesse.name: Jesse
jesse.bio: Son of Obed, father of eight sons including David, and at least two daughters (Zeruiah and Abigail). Lived in Bethlehem. When Samuel came to anoint a king, Jesse presented seven sons but overlooked David. God chose David, the youngest shepherd. Jesse is called 'the Bethlehemite' and later 'the father of David.' Isaiah prophesied that a shoot would come from the stump of Jesse. Sent provisions to his sons in Saul's army, leading to David's encounter with Goliath. In his old age, David entrusted him to the king of Moab for safety.

eliab_jesse.name: Eliab (Jesse's son)
eliab_jesse.bio: Firstborn son of Jesse, impressive in appearance. When Samuel saw him, he thought surely this was the LORD's anointed, but God said He looks at the heart, not outward appearance. Later showed hostility toward his brother David when David came to the battle against Goliath. His daughter Abihail married Rehoboam.

abinadab_jesse.name: Abinadab (Jesse's son)
abinadab_jesse.bio: Second son of Jesse. Passed over by Samuel when anointing the king. Served in Saul's army against the Philistines.

shammah_jesse.name: Shammah (Jesse's son)
shammah_jesse.bio: Third son of Jesse (also called Shimea, Shimeah). Passed over by Samuel. Father of Jonathan who killed a giant. Served in Saul's army.

nethaneel.name: Nethaneel (Jesse's son)
nethaneel.bio: Fourth son of Jesse in 1 Chronicles genealogy.

raddai.name: Raddai
raddai.bio: Fifth son of Jesse in 1 Chronicles genealogy.

ozem_jesse.name: Ozem (Jesse's son)
ozem_jesse.bio: Sixth son of Jesse. Distinct from Ozem son of Jerahmeel.

zeruiah.name: Zeruiah
zeruiah.bio: Daughter of Jesse, sister of David. Mother of three mighty warriors: Abishai, Joab, and Asahel. Her sons were fiercely loyal to David but also violent and difficult to control. Their father is not named; they are always identified as 'sons of Zeruiah.' She is mentioned frequently because of her sons' prominence.

abishai.name: Abishai
abishai.bio: Son of Zeruiah, nephew and mighty warrior of David. Volunteered to kill Saul when David spared him. Wanted to kill Shimei for cursing David. Chief of the Thirty, killed 300 men with his spear. Loyal to David through all rebellions. Fierce in battle, but David sometimes had to restrain his violence. Commanded troops under Joab. Saved David's life in battle against a giant.

joab.name: Joab
joab.bio: Son of Zeruiah, nephew of David. Commander of David's army throughout his reign. Brilliant military strategist who won many victories. Killed Abner in revenge for his brother Asahel's death. Killed Absalom against David's orders. Later killed Amasa. Murdered Uriah by proxy on David's order. Supported Adonijah over Solomon. Violent and ruthless but loyal to David. David's last instructions were that Solomon should not let him die in peace. Killed by Benaiah at the altar by Solomon's order.

asahel.name: Asahel
asahel.bio: Son of Zeruiah, youngest of the three brothers. One of David's thirty mighty men. Famous for being as swift as a wild gazelle. Pursued Abner after battle, refusing to turn aside. Abner killed him reluctantly in self-defense by a backward thrust of his spear. His death led Joab to later murder Abner in revenge. His son Zebadiah succeeded him as commander.

abigail_david.name: Abigail (David's sister)
abigail_david.bio: Daughter of Jesse (or Nahash), sister of David and Zeruiah. Mother of Amasa, who briefly served as commander before being killed by Joab. Distinct from Abigail the wife of Nabal whom David married.

amasa.name: Amasa
amasa.bio: Son of Abigail (David's sister) and Jether the Ishmaelite, making him David's nephew. Absalom made him commander during his rebellion instead of Joab. After Absalom's death, David forgave him and made him commander in place of Joab. While gathering troops, Joab deceitfully murdered him, ostensibly with a friendly greeting but stabbing him in the belly. His blood spilled on the highway, shocking those who saw.

david.name: David
david.bio: Youngest son of Jesse, second king of Israel, man after God's own heart. Anointed by Samuel while still a shepherd boy. Killed Goliath with a sling and stone. Best friend of Jonathan despite Saul's jealousy. Musician who soothed Saul and wrote many psalms. Mighty warrior who defeated Israel's enemies. United the twelve tribes and made Jerusalem the capital. Sinned with Bathsheba and murdered Uriah, but repented deeply. Received covenant that his throne would be established forever (fulfilled in Christ). Prophet, poet, warrior, and king. Died at 70 after reigning 40 years. Ancestor of Jesus Christ.

amnon.name: Amnon
amnon.bio: Firstborn son of David by Ahinoam of Jezreel. Developed an obsessive infatuation with his half-sister Tamar. Following his friend Jonadab's wicked counsel, he pretended illness and raped Tamar, then immediately hated her intensely. David was furious but did not punish him. Two years later, Absalom avenged his sister by having his servants kill Amnon at a feast. His death as firstborn opened succession questions.

daniel_david.name: Daniel (David's son)
daniel_david.bio: Second son of David by Abigail (widow of Nabal). Also called Chileab in 2 Samuel. Nothing else is recorded about him; he may have died young or been unfit for kingship.

absalom.name: Absalom
absalom.bio: Third son of David by Maacah, daughter of King Talmai of Geshur. Handsome without blemish, famous for his beautiful hair. Killed his brother Amnon for raping his sister Tamar, then fled for three years. After returning, he stole the hearts of Israel and rebelled against David, forcing him to flee Jerusalem. Absalom's rebellion ended when his hair caught in an oak tree during battle; Joab killed him despite David's orders to deal gently with him. David mourned intensely: 'O my son Absalom, my son, my son!' Had three sons who died young and a daughter named Tamar.

tamar_absalom.name: Tamar (Absalom's daughter)
tamar_absalom.bio: Daughter of Absalom, named after his violated sister. Described as beautiful. Married Uriel of Gibeah and bore Maacah, who became the favorite wife of King Rehoboam.

adonijah.name: Adonijah
adonijah.bio: Fourth son of David by Haggith. Very handsome, born after Absalom. When David was old, he exalted himself saying 'I will be king,' getting support from Joab and Abiathar. Nathan and Bathsheba informed David, who immediately had Solomon anointed king. Adonijah's supporters fled. Solomon spared him at first, but when Adonijah requested David's last nurse Abishag as wife (seen as a claim to the throne), Solomon had him executed by Benaiah.

shephatiah_david.name: Shephatiah (David's son)
shephatiah_david.bio: Fifth son of David by Abital. Born in Hebron. No other details recorded about him.

ithream.name: Ithream
ithream.bio: Sixth son of David by Eglah (called 'David's wife,' possibly another name for Michal or indicating she was his legitimate first wife). Born in Hebron. No further information given.

shammua.name: Shammua (David's son)
shammua.bio: Son of David born in Jerusalem to Bathsheba (also called Shimea). One of four sons by Bathsheba listed after David moved to Jerusalem.

shobab.name: Shobab (David's son)
shobab.bio: Son of David born in Jerusalem to Bathsheba. Listed among the sons born after David captured Jerusalem.

nathan_david.name: Nathan (David's son)
nathan_david.bio: Son of David and Bathsheba, born in Jerusalem. Brother of Solomon. Though Solomon inherited the throne, Nathan's line is recorded in Luke's genealogy of Jesus, possibly representing Mary's lineage. A prophet also named Nathan was David's contemporary but was a different person.

mattatha.name: Mattatha
mattatha.bio: Son of Nathan, descendant in the line of David recorded in Luke's genealogy.

menna.name: Menna
menna.bio: Son of Mattatha, continued the line of Nathan in Luke's genealogy.

melea.name: Melea
melea.bio: Son of Menna, part of Nathan’s line, continuing down the generations in Luke’s Gospel.

eliakim_luke.name: Eliakim
eliakim_luke.bio: Son of Melea, one of the ancestors of Jesus Christ through Mary.

jonan.name: Jonan
jonan.bio: Son of Eliakim, continuing the line of Nathan and David.

joseph_luke.name: Joseph (Luke's line)
joseph_luke.bio: Husband of Mary, from the family of David through Nathan. He was the earthly father of Jesus, though not his biological father.

mary.name: Mary
mary.bio: Mother of Jesus, the virgin who gave birth to the Messiah. Mary’s lineage traces back to David through Nathan, showing Jesus’ rightful claim to David’s throne.

jesus.name: Jesus
jesus.bio: Son of God, born of Mary, fulfilling the prophecies of the Messiah. He is the King of Israel, descendant of David, through Nathan’s line, as well as the Son of God.

ibhar.name: Ibhar
ibhar.bio: Son of David born in Jerusalem. Listed among David's sons but no details given.

elishama_david.name: Elishama (David's son)
elishama_david.bio: Son of David born in Jerusalem. First of two sons with this name (the other also born in Jerusalem).

eliphelet_david.name: Eliphelet (David's son)
eliphelet_david.bio: Son of David born in Jerusalem. First of two sons with this name.

nogah.name: Nogah
nogah.bio: Son of David born in Jerusalem. Listed only in Chronicles.

nepheg.name: Nepheg (David's son)
nepheg.bio: Son of David born in Jerusalem. Distinct from other Nephegs in Scripture.

japhia.name: Japhia (David's son)
japhia.bio: Son of David born in Jerusalem. Not to be confused with King Japhia of Lachish in Joshua's time.

elishama2_david.name: Elishama (second)
elishama2_david.bio: Another son of David born in Jerusalem with the same name as an earlier son. This occurs in several cases among David's sons.

eliada.name: Eliada (David's son)
eliada.bio: Son of David born in Jerusalem. Also called Beeliada, with the name changed to remove 'Baal.'

eliphelet2_david.name: Eliphelet (second)
eliphelet2_david.bio: Another son of David born in Jerusalem with the same name as an earlier son.

tamar_david.name: Tamar (David's daughter)
tamar_david.bio: Daughter of David and Maacah, sister of Absalom, half-sister of Amnon. Beautiful and virgin. Amnon became obsessed with her and raped her after pretending to be ill. David was furious but took no action against Amnon. Absalom comforted her, telling her to be quiet about it, and she lived desolate in his house. Two years later, Absalom had Amnon killed in revenge.

solomon.name: Solomon
solomon.bio: Son of David and Bathsheba, third king of Israel. His name means 'peace' (also called Jedidiah, 'beloved of the LORD'). God appeared to him at Gibeon, offering anything; Solomon asked for wisdom. God gave him unparalleled wisdom, plus riches and honor. Built the magnificent temple in Jerusalem. Wrote Proverbs, Ecclesiastes, and Song of Solomon. Judged wisely (two mothers, one baby). Visited by Queen of Sheba. Tragic decline: married 700 wives and 300 concubines who turned his heart to idols. God told him the kingdom would be torn from his son. Reigned 40 years in peace and prosperity, but sowed seeds of division. The Davidic covenant continued through him to Christ.

rehoboam.name: Rehoboam
rehoboam.bio: Son of Solomon by Naamah an Ammonite, fourth king of Judah. When he became king at 41, the people asked for lighter burdens. Rejecting elders' counsel, he followed young advisers and threatened heavier burdens. This caused ten northern tribes to rebel under Jeroboam, splitting the kingdom. He reigned 17 years in Jerusalem. In his fifth year, Pharaoh Shishak invaded and took temple treasures. He did evil and did not set his heart to seek the LORD. Had 18 wives, 60 concubines, 28 sons, and 60 daughters. Fortified cities in Judah.

abijah_judah.name: Abijah (Judah)
abijah_judah.bio: Son of Rehoboam by Maacah (Absalom's granddaughter), fifth king of Judah. Also called Abijam. Reigned 3 years in Jerusalem. Walked in his father's sins, but for David's sake, God gave him a lamp in Jerusalem. Fought against Jeroboam with a smaller army but won decisively because he relied on God. Had 14 wives, 22 sons, and 16 daughters. His heart was not fully devoted to the LORD like David's.

asa.name: Asa
asa.bio: Son of Abijah, sixth king of Judah. Reigned 41 years, longest reign of early Judean kings. Did right in the LORD's eyes. Removed idols, high places, sacred stones, and Asherah poles. Deposed his grandmother Maacah for making an Asherah pole. Reformed worship and made a covenant to seek God. Defeated the Cushite army of one million. Later relied on Aram instead of God when threatened by Israel. Became diseased in his feet but sought physicians, not God. Died of the disease in his 41st year.

jehoshaphat.name: Jehoshaphat
jehoshaphat.bio: Son of Asa, seventh king of Judah. Reigned 25 years. His name means 'the LORD judges.' Walked in godly ways, removed high places and Asherah poles, sent officials to teach the Law. God gave him great riches and honor. Made peace with Israel but unwisely allied with wicked Ahab, nearly dying in battle. Prophet Jehu rebuked him. Appointed judges throughout the land. Faced a vast army but sought God; after worship, God caused the enemies to destroy each other. Later allied with Ahaziah in shipping venture that God destroyed. Generally godly but compromised through alliances with wicked northern kings.

jehoram_judah.name: Jehoram (Judah)
jehoram_judah.bio: Son of Jehoshaphat, eighth king of Judah. Married Athaliah, daughter of Ahab and Jezebel. Reigned 8 years. Walked in the ways of the kings of Israel and did evil. When he became king at 32, he killed all his brothers and some princes. Edom revolted successfully. God afflicted him with an incurable disease of the bowels. After two years of suffering, his bowels came out and he died in agony. His subjects did not make a fire in his honor, and he was not buried in the royal tombs.

ahaziah_judah.name: Ahaziah (Judah)
ahaziah_judah.bio: Son of Jehoram and Athaliah, ninth king of Judah (also called Jehoahaz and Azariah in some texts). Reigned one year. His mother was his counselor in doing evil. He was 22 when he began to reign. Walked in the ways of Ahab's house, as he was related through marriage. Went with Joram of Israel to fight Aram. While visiting wounded Joram, Jehu killed both kings, fulfilling prophecy against Ahab's house. Ahaziah fled but was shot, dying at Megiddo.

joash_judah.name: Joash (Judah)
joash_judah.bio: Son of Ahaziah, tenth king of Judah (also called Jehoash). Hidden as an infant by his aunt Jehosheba when Athaliah sought to destroy the royal family. Crowned king at age seven under the guidance of the priest Jehoiada. During his early reign he did what was right in the eyes of the LORD, repairing the temple and restoring proper worship. However, after Jehoiada’s death, Joash turned to idolatry and ordered the stoning of Zechariah, Jehoiada’s son. As judgment, his officials conspired against him and killed him in the Millo. He was buried in the City of David but not in the royal tombs.

ahitub2.name: Ahitub (second)
ahitub2.bio: Son of Amariah, high priest. Distinct from the earlier Ahitub who was father of Zadok.

zadok2.name: Zadok (second)
zadok2.bio: Son of Ahitub, high priest. Distinct from the famous Zadok of David's time.

shallum_zadok.name: Shallum (Zadok's line)
shallum_zadok.bio: Son of Zadok, high priest (also called Meshullam). Father of Hilkiah who served under King Josiah.

hilkiah.name: Hilkiah
hilkiah.bio: Son of Shallum, high priest under King Josiah. He discovered the Book of the Law in the temple during Josiah's reforms, which led to a great revival. He participated in the celebration of Passover. Father of Jeremiah the prophet (a different Hilkiah).

azariah_hilkiah.name: Azariah (Hilkiah's line)
azariah_hilkiah.bio: Son of Hilkiah, high priest during the latter days of Judah.

seraiah.name: Seraiah
seraiah.bio: Son of Azariah, last high priest before the Babylonian exile. When Jerusalem fell to Nebuchadnezzar, he was taken to Riblah and executed. His son Jehozadak went into exile. Through Seraiah came the line to Ezra the scribe.

jehozadak.name: Jehozadak (Jozadak)
jehozadak.bio: Son of Seraiah, high priest who went into Babylonian exile. Though he served as high priest in exile, he never returned to Jerusalem. His son Jeshua (Joshua) returned with Zerubbabel and served as high priest in the rebuilt temple.

jeshua.name: Jeshua (Joshua)
jeshua.bio: Son of Jehozadak, first high priest after the Babylonian exile. Returned from exile with Zerubbabel and led the rebuilding of the altar and temple. Worked alongside Zerubbabel to restore worship in Jerusalem despite opposition. Haggai and Zechariah prophesied to encourage him. Zechariah had a vision of him being cleansed and crowned, symbolic of the coming Messiah.

ithamar.name: Ithamar
ithamar.bio: Fourth and youngest son of Aaron. Unlike his older brothers Nadab and Abihu, he remained faithful. He and Eleazar became priests after their brothers' deaths. He oversaw the Gershonites and Merarites in carrying the tabernacle. Through him came the line of Eli. His descendants alternated with Eleazar's in the priestly divisions organized by David.

eli.name: Eli
eli.bio: High priest and judge of Israel for 40 years, descendant of Ithamar. He raised Samuel after Hannah dedicated him to the LORD. His own sons Hophni and Phinehas were wicked priests who dishonored God. He failed to restrain them, leading to judgment on his house. He fell backward and died when he heard the Ark was captured by the Philistines. God's judgment on his house fulfilled prophecy that the priesthood would be taken from Eli's line and given to a faithful priest (ultimately fulfilled in Zadok).

hophni.name: Hophni
hophni.bio: Son of Eli, wicked priest who served at Shiloh. He and his brother Phinehas treated the LORD's offering with contempt, taking meat by force and sleeping with women at the tabernacle entrance. Despite prophecies of judgment, they did not repent. Both were killed in battle when the Philistines captured the Ark of the Covenant.

phinehas_eli.name: Phinehas (Eli's son)
phinehas_eli.bio: Son of Eli, wicked priest. Like his brother Hophni, he despised the LORD's offerings and committed sexual immorality at the tabernacle. His wife gave birth to Ichabod ('no glory') as he died and the Ark was captured. His death fulfilled God's judgment on Eli's house.

ichabod.name: Ichabod
ichabod.bio: Son of Phinehas, born on the day the Ark was captured, his father and grandfather Eli died, and the Philistines defeated Israel. His mother named him Ichabod ('no glory' or 'where is the glory?') declaring 'The glory has departed from Israel,' then died in childbirth. His name became a byword for the departure of God's presence.

izhar.name: Izhar
izhar.bio: Son of Kohath, father of Korah who led the rebellion against Moses. His other descendants included faithful Levites.

korah_izhar.name: Korah (Izhar's son)
korah_izhar.bio: Son of Izhar, Levite from Kohath's clan. Led a rebellion against Moses and Aaron with 250 leaders, challenging their authority. God vindicated Moses by causing the earth to open and swallow Korah, Dathan, Abiram, and their families alive. Fire consumed the 250 leaders. Surprisingly, 'the sons of Korah did not die' and became famous psalm writers. His rebellion became a warning against presumption.

assir_korah.name: Assir (Korah's line)
assir_korah.bio: Son of Korah who did not die in the rebellion. His descendants became temple musicians and wrote many psalms.

elkanah_korah.name: Elkanah (Korah's line)
elkanah_korah.bio: Son of Korah who survived the rebellion. Part of the Korahite line that served in temple worship.

abiasaph.name: Abiasaph (Ebiasaph)
abiasaph.bio: Son of Korah who survived. His descendants became gatekeepers and musicians in the temple. Also called Ebiasaph.

hebron_kohath.name: Hebron (Kohath's line)
hebron_kohath.bio: Son of Kohath, head of the Hebronite clan among the Levites.

uzziel_kohath.name: Uzziel (Kohath's line)
uzziel_kohath.bio: Son of Kohath, head of the Uzzielite clan among the Levites. His descendants had various temple duties.

moses.name: Moses
moses.bio: Son of Amram and Jochebed, brother of Aaron and Miriam. Greatest prophet and lawgiver of Israel. Drawn from the Nile by Pharaoh's daughter, raised in Egypt's court. Fled to Midian after killing an Egyptian, where God called him from the burning bush. Led Israel out of Egypt through ten plagues and the Red Sea crossing. Received the Law on Mount Sinai. Interceded repeatedly for rebellious Israel. Not permitted to enter the Promised Land for striking the rock. Saw the land from Mount Nebo and died there at age 120. God buried him in an unknown location. His face shone after speaking with God.

gershom_moses.name: Gershom (Moses' son)
gershom_moses.bio: Firstborn son of Moses and Zipporah, born in Midian. His name means 'sojourner there,' reflecting Moses' statement 'I have been a sojourner in a foreign land.' His descendants became Levites, with one (Jonathan) becoming a priest at Dan, though this was irregular.

jonathan_gershom.name: Jonathan (Gershom's line)
jonathan_gershom.bio: Descendant of Moses (some texts say descendant of Manasseh to avoid embarrassment). He became priest for the tribe of Dan's idolatrous shrine at Laish, a negative example in Judges. His descendants continued as priests there until the exile.

eliezer_moses.name: Eliezer (Moses' son)
eliezer_moses.bio: Second son of Moses and Zipporah. His name means 'My God is help,' reflecting Moses' gratitude: 'The God of my father was my help, and delivered me from the sword of Pharaoh.' His descendants became Levitical officials.

rehabiah.name: Rehabiah
rehabiah.bio: Son of Eliezer, grandson of Moses. Though Eliezer had only one named son, Rehabiah had many descendants who served as Levitical officials.

miriam.name: Miriam
miriam.bio: Daughter of Amram and Jochebed, sister of Moses and Aaron. A prophetess who watched over baby Moses in the Nile and suggested their mother as his nurse. Led the women in song and dance after crossing the Red Sea. Later challenged Moses' authority with Aaron and was struck with leprosy for seven days until Moses interceded. She died and was buried at Kadesh in the wilderness. One of the three leaders God sent before Israel.

merari.name: Merari
merari.bio: Third son of Levi. His descendants formed one of the three main Levitical clans, responsible for the frames, bars, pillars, and bases of the tabernacle—the structural framework. They camped north of the tabernacle and received four carts and eight oxen for transport.

mahli.name: Mahli
mahli.bio: Son of Merari, head of the Mahlite clan of Levites who served in the tabernacle and temple.

mushi.name: Mushi
mushi.bio: Son of Merari, head of the Mushite clan of Levites. His descendants served in various capacities in worship and temple maintenance.

judah.name: Judah
judah.bio: Fourth son of Jacob by Leah. His name means 'praise.' Initially suggested selling Joseph into slavery. Later offered himself as substitute for Benjamin in Egypt, showing transformation. Father of twins Perez and Zerah by Tamar (his daughter-in-law). Received the greatest blessing from Jacob: the scepter would not depart from Judah until Shiloh (Messiah) comes. His tribe became the royal tribe, through which came David and ultimately Christ. The southern kingdom was named after him.

er.name: Er
er.bio: Firstborn son of Judah by his Canaanite wife Shua. He married Tamar but was wicked in the LORD's sight, so God put him to death before he had children. His death set in motion the account of Judah and Tamar.

onan.name: Onan
onan.bio: Second son of Judah. Following levirate marriage law, he was to raise up offspring for his dead brother Er through Tamar. However, he deliberately prevented pregnancy to avoid giving his brother an heir. This wickedness displeased the LORD, who put him to death as well.

shelah_judah.name: Shelah (Judah's son)
shelah_judah.bio: Third son of Judah by his Canaanite wife. Judah promised him to Tamar but failed to give him to her when he grew up, fearing he would die like his brothers. His descendants formed a clan in Judah.

zerah_judah.name: Zerah (Judah's line)
zerah_judah.bio: Twin son of Judah and Tamar. During birth, he put out his hand first and received a scarlet thread, but then drew back and Perez was born first. His descendants included wise men like Ethan and Heman, and Achan who troubled Israel. The royal line came through his twin Perez, not him.

zimri_zerah.name: Zimri (Zerah's line)
zimri_zerah.bio: Son of Zerah, father of Carmi. Through Carmi came Achan who took devoted things at Jericho.

carmi_zimri.name: Carmi (Zimri's line)
carmi_zimri.bio: Son of Zimri, father of Achan (also called Achar). Distinct from other Carmis.

achan.name: Achan (Achar)
achan.bio: Son of Carmi from the tribe of Judah. Disobeyed God's command by taking devoted plunder from Jericho (a beautiful robe, silver, and gold), hiding it in his tent. His sin caused Israel's defeat at Ai and the death of 36 men. Discovered by lot, he confessed and was stoned to death with his family in the Valley of Achor. His name means 'trouble' and he is remembered as the one 'who brought trouble on Israel.'

ethan.name: Ethan the Ezrahite
ethan.bio: Son of Zerah, a wise man whose wisdom was surpassed only by Solomon's. Credited with writing Psalm 89. He and his brothers were famous for their wisdom.

heman_zerah.name: Heman (Zerah's line)
heman_zerah.bio: Son of Zerah, a wise man whose wisdom was compared to Solomon's. Credited with writing Psalm 88. Not to be confused with Heman the musician who descended from Kohath.

calcol.name: Calcol
calcol.bio: Son of Zerah, one of the wise men whose wisdom was surpassed by Solomon.

dara.name: Dara (Darda)
dara.bio: Son of Zerah, one of the wise men whose wisdom was exceeded by Solomon's.

perez.name: Perez
perez.bio: Twin son of Judah and Tamar (his daughter-in-law), born before his twin Zerah. His birth came through unusual circumstances when Tamar disguised herself after Judah failed to give her Shelah as promised. Though the circumstances were irregular, God used this line for the royal lineage. Through Perez came Boaz, Jesse, David, and ultimately Christ. His name means 'breach' or 'breakthrough.'

hamul.name: Hamul
hamul.bio: Son of Perez, founder of the Hamulite clan in Judah.

hezron_judah.name: Hezron (Judah's line)
hezron_judah.bio: Son of Perez, went to Egypt with Jacob. His line split: through Ram came David and the kings; through Caleb came mighty warriors. He married a daughter of Machir (Manasseh's son) late in life. Lived 60+ years. A key link between Judah and David.

caleb.name: Caleb (Hezron's son)
caleb.bio: Son of Hezron (distinct from Caleb the spy). Father of Hur. His descendants included important figures in Judah's genealogy.

hur.name: Hur
hur.bio: Son of Caleb, grandson of Hezron. He and Aaron held up Moses' hands during the battle with Amalek. Left in charge with Aaron when Moses went up Mount Sinai. Grandfather of Bezalel, the master craftsman of the tabernacle.

uri.name: Uri
uri.bio: Son of Hur, father of Bezalel the master craftsman.

bezalel.name: Bezalel
bezalel.bio: Son of Uri, great-grandson of Hezron. Chosen and filled by God's Spirit with skill, intelligence, and knowledge in all craftsmanship. Master builder of the tabernacle, ark of the covenant, and all its furnishings. First person in Scripture said to be filled with the Spirit. Worked with Oholiab and taught others. His name means 'in the shadow/protection of God.'

mareshah.name: Mareshah
mareshah.bio: Son of Caleb, father of Hebron in Judah's genealogy.

jerahmeel.name: Jerahmeel
jerahmeel.bio: Firstborn son of Hezron, brother of Ram (David's ancestor) and Caleb. His descendants formed a clan (Jerahmeelites) in southern Judah.

ram_jerahmeel.name: Ram (Jerahmeel's line)
ram_jerahmeel.bio: Firstborn son of Jerahmeel. Distinct from Ram the ancestor of David.

ozem_jerahmeel.name: Ozem (Jerahmeel's line)
ozem_jerahmeel.bio: Son of Jerahmeel. Distinct from Ozem, son of Jesse.

ram.name: Ram (David's ancestor)
ram.bio: Son of Hezron, father of Amminadab. Direct ancestor of King David in the royal line. Also called Aram in some translations. Through him the covenant promises to Judah were passed down.

amminadab.name: Amminadab
amminadab.bio: Son of Ram, father of Nahshon. Ancestor of David and Jesus in the royal lineage. His daughter Elisheba married Aaron, the brother of Moses, linking the royal and priestly lines of Israel.

cain.name: Cain
cain.bio: Firstborn son of Adam and Eve. A farmer who brought an offering of crops to God, which was not accepted. In jealousy, he murdered his brother Abel, becoming the first murderer. God marked him and sent him to wander in the land of Nod, east of Eden, where he built a city named after his son Enoch.

abel.name: Abel
abel.bio: Second son of Adam and Eve. A shepherd who brought the firstborn of his flock as an offering to God, which was accepted. He was murdered by his brother Cain out of jealousy. Abel is remembered as the first martyr and a man of faith whose blood cried out from the ground.

enoch_cain.name: Enoch (Cain's line)
enoch_cain.bio: Son of Cain, after whom Cain named the first city he built. This Enoch is distinct from the righteous Enoch in Seth's line who walked with God.

irad.name: Irad
irad.bio: Son of Enoch in Cain's genealogical line. Little else is recorded about him.

mehujael.name: Mehujael
mehujael.bio: Descendant of Cain through Irad. Part of the ungodly line that did not call upon the name of the LORD.

methushael.name: Methushael
methushael.bio: Father of Lamech in Cain's genealogical line. His name is similar to Methuselah in Seth's line.

lamech_cain.name: Lamech (Cain's line)
lamech_cain.bio: Descendant of Cain who took two wives (Adah and Zillah), becoming the first recorded polygamist. He boasted of killing a young man who wounded him and claimed greater vengeance than Cain. His children became founders of various crafts and arts.

jabal.name: Jabal
jabal.bio: Son of Lamech and Adah. He was the father of those who dwell in tents and have livestock, essentially the ancestor of nomadic herdsmen and pastoral culture.

jubal.name: Jubal
jubal.bio: Son of Lamech and Adah, brother of Jabal. He was the father of all who play the harp and flute, making him the ancestor of musicians and musical culture.

tubalcain.name: Tubal-Cain
tubalcain.bio: Son of Lamech and Zillah. He was an instructor of every craftsman in bronze and iron, becoming the ancestor of metalworking and tool-making.

naamah.name: Naamah
naamah.bio: Daughter of Lamech and Zillah, sister of Tubal-Cain. One of the few women mentioned in the early genealogies before the flood.

seth.name: Seth
seth.bio: Third named son of Adam and Eve, born after Abel's murder. His name means 'appointed' or 'granted,' as Eve said God appointed him in place of Abel. Through Seth came the godly line that called upon the name of the LORD, leading ultimately to Noah and Christ.

enosh.name: Enosh
enosh.bio: Son of Seth and grandson of Adam. During his lifetime, people began to call upon the name of the LORD. His name means 'mortal' or 'frail man,' reflecting human mortality after the Fall.

kenan.name: Kenan
kenan.bio: Son of Enosh in the Genesis 5 genealogy. He lived 910 years, part of the long-lived antediluvian patriarchs. Little else is recorded about his life.

mahalalel.name: Mahalalel
mahalalel.bio: Son of Kenan and father of Jared. He lived 895 years. His name means 'praise of God' or 'God is splendor,' continuing the godly line from Adam to Noah.

jared.name: Jared
jared.bio: Son of Mahalalel and father of Enoch. He lived 962 years, making him the second-longest lived person recorded in Scripture after his grandson Methuselah. His name means 'descent.'

enoch.name: Enoch
enoch.bio: Son of Jared, father of Methuselah. He walked faithfully with God for 300 years after Methuselah's birth. At age 365, God took him directly to heaven without experiencing death. He prophesied about the Lord's coming with thousands of holy ones. Enoch stands as an example of faith and fellowship with God.

methuselah.name: Methuselah
methuselah.bio: Son of Enoch and father of Lamech. He holds the record for the longest lifespan in Scripture at 969 years. His name may mean 'when he dies, it shall come,' and notably, he died the same year as the flood. He represents God's patience in delaying judgment.

lamech.name: Lamech (Seth's line)
lamech.bio: Son of Methuselah and father of Noah. He lived 777 years. When Noah was born, Lamech prophesied that his son would bring comfort from the curse God placed on the ground. This Lamech is distinct from the violent Lamech in Cain's line.

noah.name: Noah
noah.bio: Son of Lamech, father of Shem, Ham, and Japheth. A righteous man who walked with God in a corrupt generation. God instructed him to build an ark to save his family and representatives of all animals from the worldwide flood. After the flood, God made a covenant with Noah (rainbow covenant) promising never to destroy the earth by flood again. He lived 950 years.

shem.name: Shem
shem.bio: Eldest named son of Noah, father of the Semitic peoples. Along with Japheth, he respectfully covered his father's nakedness and received Noah's blessing. The covenant line continues through him to Abraham and ultimately Christ. He lived 600 years.

elam.name: Elam
elam.bio: First listed son of Shem, ancestor of the Elamites who inhabited the Persian region. Elam became a significant ancient kingdom east of Mesopotamia.

asshur.name: Asshur
asshur.bio: Son of Shem, ancestor and likely founder of the Assyrians. Assyria became a major empire that eventually conquered the northern kingdom of Israel.

lud.name: Lud
lud.bio: Son of Shem, ancestor of the Lydians who settled in western Asia Minor (modern-day Turkey). The Lydians were known for commerce and warfare.

aram.name: Aram
aram.bio: Son of Shem, ancestor of the Arameans (Syrians). The Aramaic language became the lingua franca of the ancient Near East. Damascus was the capital of Aram. The Arameans had frequent interactions, both peaceful and hostile, with Israel.

uz.name: Uz
uz.bio: Son of Aram, gave his name to the land of Uz where Job lived. The location of Uz is debated but was likely in northern Arabia or Edom.

hul.name: Hul
hul.bio: Son of Aram in the Table of Nations. Little else is known about his descendants.

gether.name: Gether
gether.bio: Son of Aram listed in the Table of Nations. His descendants are not clearly identified in Scripture.

mash.name: Mash
mash.bio: Son of Aram (also called Meshech in 1 Chronicles). Part of the Aramean peoples descended from Shem.

ham.name: Ham
ham.bio: Son of Noah, father of Cush, Mizraim, Put, and Canaan. He saw his father's nakedness and did not cover him respectfully, leading Noah to curse Ham's son Canaan. Through Ham came many peoples including Egyptians, Cushites, and Canaanites.

cush.name: Cush
cush.bio: Son of Ham, father of Nimrod. Ancestor of the Cushites who inhabited the region of Ethiopia/Nubia in Africa. His name became synonymous with the land of Cush (Ethiopia).

seba.name: Seba
seba.bio: Son of Cush, associated with a region in southern Arabia or northeast Africa. Possibly connected to the Sabaeans.

havilah_cush.name: Havilah (Cush's line)
havilah_cush.bio: Son of Cush, gave his name to a region rich in gold mentioned in Genesis 2. Different from Havilah descended from Joktan.

sabtah.name: Sabtah
sabtah.bio: Son of Cush listed in the Table of Nations. His descendants likely settled in southern Arabia.

raamah.name: Raamah
raamah.bio: Son of Cush and father of Sheba and Dedan. Associated with a trading people in southern Arabia.

sheba_raamah.name: Sheba (Raamah's line)
sheba_raamah.bio: Son of Raamah, grandson of Cush. Part of the Arabian trading peoples. Distinct from other Shebas in Scripture.

dedan_raamah.name: Dedan (Raamah's line)
dedan_raamah.bio: Son of Raamah, associated with trading peoples in northern Arabia. Distinct from Dedan descended from Abraham.

sabteca.name: Sabteca
sabteca.bio: Son of Cush listed in the Table of Nations. His descendants likely inhabited regions in or near Ethiopia.

nimrod.name: Nimrod
nimrod.bio: Son of Cush, described as a mighty warrior and hunter before the LORD. He founded several cities including Babel (Babylon), Erech, Accad, and Nineveh. Tradition associates him with building the Tower of Babel in rebellion against God. He established the first kingdom after the flood.

mizraim.name: Mizraim
mizraim.bio: Son of Ham, ancestor and Hebrew name for Egypt. His descendants populated Egypt and surrounding regions including the Philistines.

ludim.name: Ludim
ludim.bio: Son of Mizraim, possibly ancestor of a North African people near Egypt.

anamim.name: Anamim
anamim.bio: Son of Mizraim, probably associated with a people group in the Nile Delta region.

lehabim.name: Lehabim
lehabim.bio: Son of Mizraim, possibly connected to Libya or Libyan peoples.

naphtuhim.name: Naphtuhim
naphtuhim.bio: Son of Mizraim, associated with a people group in central or lower Egypt.

pathrusim.name: Pathrusim
pathrusim.bio: Son of Mizraim, ancestor of people from Pathros (upper/southern Egypt). Pathros is mentioned in several prophetic passages.

casluhim.name: Casluhim
casluhim.bio: Son of Mizraim, from whom came the Philistines according to Genesis (though other passages also connect them to Caphtor/Crete).

caphtorim.name: Caphtorim
caphtorim.bio: Son of Mizraim, associated with Caphtor (likely Crete or Cyprus). Also connected to the origin of the Philistines.

put.name: Put
put.bio: Son of Ham, ancestor of peoples in Libya/North Africa. Put (Libya) is mentioned alongside other nations in prophetic and historical contexts.

canaan.name: Canaan
canaan.bio: Fourth son of Ham, cursed by Noah because of Ham's disrespect. Ancestor of the Canaanite peoples who occupied the Promised Land before Israel. The curse led to their eventual displacement by Israel, though the moral justification was their great wickedness.

sidon.name: Sidon
sidon.bio: Firstborn of Canaan, ancestor and namesake of the Sidonians, a prominent Phoenician people. The city of Sidon became a major port and trading center.

heth.name: Heth
heth.bio: Son of Canaan, ancestor of the Hittites. The Hittites were prominent in Canaan; Abraham bought the cave of Machpelah from them. The great Hittite empire was centered in Anatolia.

jebusite.name: Jebusite
jebusite.bio: Son of Canaan, ancestor of the Jebusites who originally inhabited Jerusalem (called Jebus). David conquered the city from them, making it his capital.

amorite.name: Amorite
amorite.bio: Son of Canaan, ancestor of the Amorites, one of the most powerful and widespread Canaanite peoples. They occupied the hill country and are frequently mentioned as enemies of Israel.

girgashite.name: Girgashite
girgashite.bio: Son of Canaan, ancestor of the Girgashites, one of the seven nations of Canaan. Less is known about them compared to other Canaanite peoples.

hivite.name: Hivite
hivite.bio: Son of Canaan, ancestor of the Hivites, one of the Canaanite peoples. They lived in various regions including Shechem and Gibeon. The Gibeonites who deceived Joshua were Hivites.

arkite.name: Arkite
arkite.bio: Son of Canaan, associated with the city of Arka in northern Phoenicia/Lebanon.

sinite.name: Sinite
sinite.bio: Son of Canaan, possibly connected to a fortress city in Lebanon or northern Canaan.

arvadite.name: Arvadite
arvadite.bio: Son of Canaan, ancestor of inhabitants of Arvad, an island city off the coast of Phoenicia. Arvadites were known as skilled mariners.

zemarite.name: Zemarite
zemarite.bio: Son of Canaan, associated with a city in Phoenicia, possibly near modern Syria/Lebanon.

hamathite.name: Hamathite
hamathite.bio: Son of Canaan, ancestor of inhabitants of Hamath, a significant city in Syria. Hamath marked Israel's northern boundary.

japheth.name: Japheth
japheth.bio: Son of Noah, father of the Indo-European nations. With Shem, he respectfully covered their father Noah's nakedness and received a blessing. Noah prophesied that Japheth would 'dwell in the tents of Shem,' indicating future blessing through Shem's line.

gomer.name: Gomer
gomer.bio: Son of Japheth, ancestor of the Cimmerians who settled in Asia Minor and the Black Sea region. The name is associated with ancient peoples north of Israel.

ashkenaz.name: Ashkenaz
ashkenaz.bio: Son of Gomer, associated with a kingdom near Ararat. Later Jewish tradition connected this name with Germany, leading to the term 'Ashkenazi Jews.'

riphath.name: Riphath
riphath.bio: Son of Gomer. The exact location of his descendants is uncertain, possibly in Asia Minor or near the Black Sea.

togarmah.name: Togarmah
togarmah.bio: Son of Gomer, associated with a region in eastern Anatolia (Turkey). Known for horses and mules in trade.

magog.name: Magog
magog.bio: Son of Japheth, ancestor of peoples in the far north. In Ezekiel's prophecy, Gog of the land of Magog is a future enemy of Israel.

madai.name: Madai
madai.bio: Son of Japheth, ancestor of the Medes who inhabited Media (northwestern Iran). The Medes partnered with Persians to conquer Babylon.

javan.name: Javan
javan.bio: Son of Japheth, ancestor of the Greeks/Ionians. His name is the Hebrew word for Greece. His descendants populated the coastlands and islands of the Mediterranean.

elishah.name: Elishah
elishah.bio: Son of Javan, associated with Cyprus or Greek islands/coastlands. Known for producing purple dye.

tarshish.name: Tarshish
tarshish.bio: Son of Javan, gave his name to a distant maritime city/region, possibly in Spain. Tarshish was known for trade in metals. Jonah tried to flee there to escape God's call.

kittim.name: Kittim
kittim.bio: Son of Javan, associated with Cyprus (ancient Kition). The name came to represent western peoples and islands in general.

dodanim.name: Dodanim
dodanim.bio: Son of Javan, possibly connected to Rhodes or other Greek islands (also called Rodanim in some texts).

tubal.name: Tubal
tubal.bio: Son of Japheth, associated with a people in eastern Asia Minor. Mentioned with Meshech as trading partners and warriors.

meshech.name: Meshech
meshech.bio: Son of Japheth, associated with a people in Asia Minor/Caucasus region. Frequently paired with Tubal in prophetic literature as distant northern peoples.

tiras.name: Tiras
tiras.bio: Son of Japheth, possibly ancestor of Thracians or other peoples in the region north of Greece and Asia Minor.

arpachshad.name: Arpachshad
arpachshad.bio: Son of Shem, born two years after the flood. Through him came the line leading to Abraham and ultimately Christ. He lived 438 years. The exact location of his descendants is debated, possibly in northern Mesopotamia.

shelah.name: Shelah
shelah.bio: Son of Arpachshad (or grandson, as Luke mentions Cainan between them), father of Eber. He lived 433 years. Part of the post-flood patriarchal line to Abraham.

eber.name: Eber
eber.bio: Son of Shelah, father of Peleg and Joktan. His name is the origin of the term 'Hebrew' (Ibri). He lived 464 years, bridging the generations from the early post-flood period to Abraham's time. His descendants included both the Hebrews (through Peleg) and many Arabian tribes (through Joktan).

joktan.name: Joktan
joktan.bio: Son of Eber, brother of Peleg. Ancestor of thirteen Arabian tribes who settled in southern Arabia. While his brother's line led to Abraham, Joktan's descendants populated the Arabian Peninsula.

almodad.name: Almodad
almodad.bio: Firstborn son of Joktan, ancestor of an Arabian tribe. The exact location of his descendants is uncertain, likely in southern Arabia.

sheleph.name: Sheleph
sheleph.bio: Son of Joktan, associated with an Arabian tribe, possibly in Yemen or southern Arabia.

hazarmaveth.name: Hazarmaveth
hazarmaveth.bio: Son of Joktan, his name means 'court of death.' Associated with Hadramaut in southern Arabia (modern Yemen).

jerah.name: Jerah
jerah.bio: Son of Joktan, his name means 'moon.' Possibly associated with a tribe in Arabia that practiced lunar worship.

hadoram.name: Hadoram
hadoram.bio: Son of Joktan, associated with an Arabian tribe, possibly in southern or eastern Arabia.

uzal.name: Uzal
uzal.bio: Son of Joktan, associated with Sana'a, the capital of modern Yemen. Known as a trading center.

diklah.name: Diklah
diklah.bio: Son of Joktan, his name possibly means 'palm tree.' Associated with an oasis region in Arabia.

obal.name: Obal
obal.bio: Son of Joktan (called Ebal in 1 Chronicles), associated with a tribe in southern Arabia.

abimael.name: Abimael
abimael.bio: Son of Joktan, his name means 'my father is God.' Associated with an Arabian tribe.

sheba_joktan.name: Sheba (Joktan's line)
sheba_joktan.bio: Son of Joktan, associated with the Sabaeans of southern Arabia (Yemen). Famous for the Queen of Sheba who visited Solomon. Distinct from other Shebas in Scripture.

ophir.name: Ophir
ophir.bio: Son of Joktan, gave his name to a region famous for gold. Solomon's ships brought gold from Ophir. The exact location is debated (Arabia, East Africa, or India).

havilah_joktan.name: Havilah (Joktan's line)
havilah_joktan.bio: Son of Joktan, associated with a region in Arabia. Distinct from Havilah son of Cush. The Ishmaelites lived 'from Havilah to Shur.'

jobab.name: Jobab
jobab.bio: Son of Joktan, last listed of his thirteen sons. Some traditions have speculated this might be Job, though this is uncertain.

peleg.name: Peleg
peleg.bio: Son of Eber, father of Reu. His name means 'division,' because 'in his days the earth was divided'—likely referring to the dispersion at Babel. He lived 239 years. The messianic line continues through him to Abraham.

reu.name: Reu
reu.bio: Son of Peleg, father of Serug. He lived 239 years. Part of the genealogical line from Noah to Abraham, connecting the early post-flood period to the patriarchs.

serug.name: Serug
serug.bio: Son of Reu, father of Nahor. He lived 230 years. Part of the transitional generations between Noah and Abraham, living during the rise of early civilizations in Mesopotamia.

nahor.name: Nahor (Terah's father)
nahor.bio: Son of Serug, father of Terah, grandfather of Abraham. He lived 148 years. The city of Nahor in Mesopotamia may have been named after him or his grandson.

terah.name: Terah
terah.bio: Son of Nahor, father of Abraham, Nahor, and Haran. He lived in Ur of the Chaldeans and moved his family to Haran in obedience to God's call to Abraham. He died in Haran at age 205. Joshua records that Terah served other gods beyond the Euphrates before God called Abraham.

abraham.name: Abraham (Abram)
abraham.bio: Son of Terah, father of Isaac, Ishmael, and six sons by Keturah. Called by God to leave Ur and go to Canaan. God made a covenant with him promising descendants as numerous as the stars, the land of Canaan, and that all nations would be blessed through him (fulfilled in Christ). Called the 'father of faith' for believing God's promise of a son in old age. Offered Isaac on Mount Moriah in the ultimate test of faith. Lived 175 years. Friend of God.

nahor2.name: Nahor (Abraham's brother)
nahor2.bio: Son of Terah, brother of Abraham and Haran. Married his niece Milcah (Haran's daughter). Father of twelve sons including Bethuel (father of Rebekah). Remained in Mesopotamia when Abraham departed for Canaan. The city of Nahor was associated with his descendants.

uz_nahor.name: Uz (Nahor's line)
uz_nahor.bio: Firstborn son of Nahor and Milcah. Possibly connected to the land of Uz where Job lived, though the connection is uncertain.

buz.name: Buz
buz.bio: Second son of Nahor and Milcah. Ancestor of Elihu the Buzite, who spoke to Job. His descendants formed a tribe in northern Arabia.

kemuel.name: Kemuel
kemuel.bio: Third son of Nahor and Milcah, father of Aram. Part of the Aramean genealogy.

aram_kemuel.name: Aram (Kemuel's son)
aram_kemuel.bio: Son of Kemuel, grandson of Nahor. Distinct from other Arams in Scripture.

chesed.name: Chesed
chesed.bio: Fourth son of Nahor and Milcah. Possibly connected to the Chaldeans (Kasdim), though this is debated.

hazo.name: Hazo
hazo.bio: Fifth son of Nahor and Milcah. His descendants are not clearly identified.

pildash.name: Pildash
pildash.bio: Sixth son of Nahor and Milcah. Little is known about his descendants.

jidlaph.name: Jidlaph
jidlaph.bio: Seventh son of Nahor and Milcah. His descendants are not identified in Scripture.

bethuel.name: Bethuel
bethuel.bio: Eighth son of Nahor and Milcah, father of Rebekah and Laban. He lived in Mesopotamia. His role in Rebekah's betrothal to Isaac is minimal, with Laban seeming to take the lead.

rebekah.name: Rebekah
rebekah.bio: Daughter of Bethuel, sister of Laban, wife of Isaac, mother of Jacob and Esau. Chosen by divine guidance to be Isaac's wife. She received a prophecy that two nations were in her womb and the older would serve the younger. She helped Jacob deceive Isaac to receive Esau's blessing. Known for her beauty, kindness, and decisiveness.

laban.name: Laban
laban.bio: Son of Bethuel, brother of Rebekah, father of Leah and Rachel. He lived in Haran (Mesopotamia). Known for deceiving Jacob by substituting Leah for Rachel on the wedding night, and for changing Jacob's wages ten times. Despite his deceptive nature, God used him in Jacob's life and through him came the mothers of the twelve tribes.

haran.name: Haran
haran.bio: Son of Terah, brother of Abraham and Nahor. Father of Lot, Milcah, and Iscah. He died in Ur of the Chaldeans before his father Terah, making him the first person recorded to die before his father.

lot.name: Lot
lot.bio: Son of Haran, nephew of Abraham. He traveled with Abraham to Canaan but separated to live in Sodom.
