Angels rescued him from Sodom's destruction, though his wife looked back and became a pillar of salt. His daughters got him drunk and became pregnant by him, producing Moab and Ammon. Peter calls him a 'righteous man' tormented by the wickedness around him.

moab.name: Moab
moab.bio: Son of Lot by his older daughter through incest after Sodom's destruction. Ancestor of the Moabites who settled east of the Dead Sea. The Moabites were often enemies of Israel, though Ruth was a Moabitess who became David's great-grandmother.

benammi.name: Ben-Ammi
benammi.bio: Son of Lot by his younger daughter through incest. His name means 'son of my people.' Ancestor of the Ammonites who settled east of the Jordan. The Ammonites were frequently hostile to Israel.

milcah.name: Milcah
milcah.bio: Daughter of Haran, sister of Lot. Married her uncle Nahor (Abraham's brother). Mother of eight sons including Bethuel (Rebekah's father). She remained in Mesopotamia.

iscah.name: Iscah
iscah.bio: Daughter of Haran, sister of Lot and Milcah. One of the few women mentioned in the early genealogies, though nothing else is recorded about her.

ishmael.name: Ishmael
ishmael.bio: Son of Abraham and Hagar (Sarah's Egyptian maidservant). Born when Abraham was 86. God promised to make him a great nation and that he would be 'a wild donkey of a man.' He was circumcised at age 13. After Isaac's birth, Sarah had him and Hagar sent away, but God preserved them. He became an archer in the desert and had twelve sons who became tribal princes. He attended Abraham's burial. Lived 137 years. Ancestor of Arab peoples.

nebaioth.name: Nebaioth
nebaioth.bio: Firstborn son of Ishmael, brother of Mahalath who married Esau. His descendants became a tribe in northern Arabia, possibly connected to the Nabateans.

kedar.name: Kedar
kedar.bio: Second son of Ishmael. His descendants became a prominent Arabian tribe known for their black tents, skilled archers, and flocks. Mentioned frequently in prophetic literature as representing Arabian peoples.

adbeel.name: Adbeel
adbeel.bio: Third son of Ishmael. His descendants formed a tribe in northern Arabia.

mibsam.name: Mibsam
mibsam.bio: Fourth son of Ishmael. His descendants settled in Arabia.

mishma.name: Mishma
mishma.bio: Fifth son of Ishmael. His tribal descendants are mentioned in Arabian genealogies.

dumah.name: Dumah
dumah.bio: Sixth son of Ishmael. Associated with Dumat al-Jandal, an oasis in northern Arabia. Isaiah prophesied concerning Dumah.

massa.name: Massa
massa.bio: Seventh son of Ishmael. His descendants formed a tribe in northern Arabia. Some speculate a connection to the wise sayings 'of Massa' in Proverbs 31.

hadad_ishmael.name: Hadad (Ishmael's line)
hadad_ishmael.bio: Eighth son of Ishmael. His descendants settled in Arabia. Distinct from other Hadads in Scripture.

tema.name: Tema
tema.bio: Ninth son of Ishmael. His descendants inhabited Tema, an important oasis in northwest Arabia on caravan routes. Mentioned in Job and prophetic literature.

jetur.name: Jetur
jetur.bio: Tenth son of Ishmael. His descendants (Jaturites/Itureans) settled in the region east of the Jordan and were later conquered by the tribe of Reuben.

naphish.name: Naphish
naphish.bio: Eleventh son of Ishmael. His descendants were defeated by the tribes of Reuben, Gad, and Manasseh.

kedemah.name: Kedemah
kedemah.bio: Twelfth son of Ishmael. His name means 'eastward' or 'toward the east,' fitting for the Ishmaelite settlement pattern. His descendants became one of the twelve Arabian tribal princes.

zimran.name: Zimran
zimran.bio: First son of Abraham by Keturah (taken after Sarah's death). His descendants may have settled in Arabia.

jokshan.name: Jokshan
jokshan.bio: Second son of Abraham by Keturah, father of Sheba and Dedan. His descendants settled in Arabia and became trading peoples.

sheba_jokshan.name: Sheba (Jokshan's line)
sheba_jokshan.bio: Son of Jokshan, grandson of Abraham and Keturah. Associated with Sabaean trading peoples. Distinct from other Shebas in Scripture.

dedan_jokshan.name: Dedan (Jokshan's line)
dedan_jokshan.bio: Son of Jokshan, grandson of Abraham. His descendants (Asshurim, Letushim, Leummim) became Arabian peoples engaged in trade. Distinct from Dedan son of Raamah.

medan.name: Medan
medan.bio: Third son of Abraham by Keturah. His descendants likely settled in northern Arabia.

midian.name: Midian
midian.bio: Fourth son of Abraham by Keturah. Ancestor of the Midianites who became a significant people east and southeast of Canaan. Moses' father-in-law Jethro was a Midianite priest. The Midianites later oppressed Israel during the period of the Judges until Gideon defeated them.

ephah.name: Ephah
ephah.bio: Son of Midian, grandson of Abraham. His descendants were known for their camels and are mentioned in prophetic passages about Arabian peoples bringing tribute.

epher.name: Epher
epher.bio: Son of Midian, grandson of Abraham. His descendants settled in the Midianite region.

hanoch_midian.name: Hanoch (Midian's line)
hanoch_midian.bio: Son of Midian, grandson of Abraham. Distinct from other Hanochs in Scripture.

abida.name: Abida
abida.bio: Son of Midian, his name means 'my father knows.' Part of the Midianite tribal structure.

eldaah.name: Eldaah
eldaah.bio: Son of Midian, his name means 'God has known.' Last listed son of Midian in the Abrahamic genealogy.

ishbak.name: Ishbak
ishbak.bio: Fifth son of Abraham by Keturah. His descendants are not clearly identified but likely settled in Arabia.

shuah.name: Shuah
shuah.bio: Sixth son of Abraham by Keturah. His descendants were the Shuhites. Bildad, one of Job's friends, was a Shuhite.

isaac.name: Isaac
isaac.bio: Son of Abraham and Sarah, born miraculously when Abraham was 100 and Sarah 90. His name means 'he laughs.' Nearly sacrificed by Abraham on Mount Moriah in the ultimate test of faith, but God provided a ram. Married Rebekah, father of Jacob and Esau. Known for his peaceful nature, digging wells, and re-digging his father's wells. Blessed Jacob thinking he was Esau. Lived 180 years. The only patriarch who never left Canaan. Through him the covenant promise continued.

esau.name: Esau (Edom)
esau.bio: Firstborn son of Isaac and Rebekah, twin brother of Jacob. A skillful hunter and outdoorsman, he was Isaac's favorite. Sold his birthright to Jacob for a bowl of stew, showing contempt for it. Married Canaanite and Ishmaelite wives, grieving his parents. Lost his blessing to Jacob through deception. Initially sought to kill Jacob but later reconciled with him. Settled in Seir (Edom) and became ancestor of the Edomites, perpetual enemies of Israel.

eliphaz_esau.name: Eliphaz (Esau's son)
eliphaz_esau.bio: Firstborn son of Esau by Adah. Father of several Edomite chiefs including Teman. His concubine Timna bore Amalek, ancestor of Israel's perpetual enemy the Amalekites.

teman.name: Teman
teman.bio: Son of Eliphaz, grandson of Esau. Became an Edomite chief. His name became synonymous with a region in Edom known for wisdom. Eliphaz the Temanite, one of Job's friends, likely came from this line.

omar.name: Omar
omar.bio: Son of Eliphaz, became an Edomite chief.

zepho.name: Zepho
zepho.bio: Son of Eliphaz, became an Edomite chief (also called Zephi).

gatam.name: Gatam
gatam.bio: Son of Eliphaz, became an Edomite chief.

kenaz.name: Kenaz (Esau's line)
kenaz.bio: Son of Eliphaz, became an Edomite chief. The Kenizzites were associated with Edom. Caleb's family later intermarried with this line.

amalek.name: Amalek
amalek.bio: Son of Eliphaz by his concubine Timna, grandson of Esau. Ancestor of the Amalekites, Israel's perpetual enemy from the Exodus onward. They attacked Israel's weak and weary in the wilderness. God commanded their complete destruction. Saul's failure to completely destroy them led to his rejection as king.

reuel.name: Reuel (Esau's son)
reuel.bio: Son of Esau by Basemath (Ishmael's daughter). Father of four sons who became Edomite chiefs. Distinct from Jethro/Reuel, Moses' father-in-law.

nahath.name: Nahath
nahath.bio: Son of Reuel, became an Edomite chief.

zerah_reuel.name: Zerah (Reuel's line)
zerah_reuel.bio: Son of Reuel, became an Edomite chief. Distinct from other Zerahs in Scripture.

shammah.name: Shammah (Edom)
shammah.bio: Son of Reuel, became an Edomite chief.

mizzah.name: Mizzah
mizzah.bio: Son of Reuel, became an Edomite chief.

jeush.name: Jeush (Esau's son)
jeush.bio: Son of Esau by Oholibamah, became an Edomite chief.

jalam.name: Jalam
jalam.bio: Son of Esau by Oholibamah, became an Edomite chief.

korah_esau.name: Korah (Esau's line)
korah_esau.bio: Son of Esau by Oholibamah, became an Edomite chief. Distinct from Korah the Levite who rebelled against Moses.

jacob.name: Jacob (Israel)
jacob.bio: Son of Isaac and Rebekah, twin brother of Esau (born holding his heel). His name means 'supplanter.' Bought Esau's birthright and deceived Isaac to receive the blessing. Fled to Haran where he served Laban 20 years for his wives Leah and Rachel. At Peniel, he wrestled with God and was renamed Israel ('he struggles with God'). Father of the twelve tribes of Israel through four women. Favored Joseph and Benjamin (Rachel's sons). Moved to Egypt in old age where he blessed his sons and grandsons before dying at 147. His body was returned to Canaan for burial.

dinah.name: Dinah
dinah.bio: Daughter of Jacob and Leah. She was defiled by Shechem, son of Hamor the Hivite. Though Shechem wanted to marry her, her brothers Simeon and Levi massacred all the men of the city in revenge, which Jacob condemned as bringing trouble upon him.

leah.name: Leah
leah.bio: Elder daughter of Laban, first wife of Jacob (through deception). Mother of six sons (Reuben, Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, Zebulun) and one daughter (Dinah). Though unloved compared to Rachel, God saw her affliction and blessed her with many children. Through Judah came the royal line to David and Christ. Buried in the cave of Machpelah.

rachel.name: Rachel
rachel.bio: Younger daughter of Laban, beloved wife of Jacob. Beautiful and loved, yet initially barren while her sister Leah bore children. Finally bore Joseph, then died giving birth to Benjamin near Bethlehem. Jacob set up a pillar on her grave. Her desperate cry 'Give me children, or I'll die' and later death in childbirth are deeply poignant. Mother of Joseph (through whom came Ephraim and Manasseh) and Benjamin.

reuben.name: Reuben
reuben.bio: Firstborn son of Jacob by Leah. Lost his birthright because he slept with his father's concubine Bilhah. He tried to save Joseph from his brothers but failed. Later offered his own two sons as surety for Benjamin. His tribe settled east of the Jordan. Jacob's blessing predicted he would not excel. The tribe of Reuben eventually declined in importance.

hanoch_reuben.name: Hanoch (Reuben's line)
hanoch_reuben.bio: Son of Reuben, founder of the Hanochite clan.

pallu.name: Pallu
pallu.bio: Son of Reuben, founder of the Palluite clan. Father of Eliab.

eliab_pallu.name: Eliab (Pallu's line)
eliab_pallu.bio: Son of Pallu, father of Dathan, Abiram, and Nemuel. His sons Dathan and Abiram joined Korah's rebellion against Moses and were swallowed by the earth.

nemuel_eliab.name: Nemuel (Eliab's line)
nemuel_eliab.bio: Son of Eliab, brother of Dathan and Abiram. Apparently did not join their rebellion.

dathan.name: Dathan
dathan.bio: Son of Eliab, from the tribe of Reuben. Along with his brother Abiram and Korah the Levite, he rebelled against Moses' leadership. The earth opened and swallowed them alive with their families and possessions. Their fate became a warning to future generations.

abiram.name: Abiram (Reuben's line)
abiram.bio: Son of Eliab, brother of Dathan. Joined in the rebellion against Moses and Aaron. Like his brother, he was swallowed alive by the earth in God's judgment.

hezron_reuben.name: Hezron (Reuben's line)
hezron_reuben.bio: Son of Reuben, founder of the Hezronite clan. Distinct from Hezron of Judah's line.

carmi_reuben.name: Carmi (Reuben's line)
carmi_reuben.bio: Son of Reuben, founder of the Carmite clan. Distinct from other Carmis in Scripture.

simeon.name: Simeon
simeon.bio: Second son of Jacob by Leah. With his brother Levi, he treacherously killed all the men of Shechem in revenge for Dinah's defilement. Jacob's blessing cursed their anger and scattered them in Israel. Simeon was held hostage in Egypt while his brothers returned to get Benjamin. His tribe received land within Judah's territory and eventually was largely absorbed by Judah.

jemuel.name: Jemuel
jemuel.bio: Son of Simeon, founder of a Simeonite clan (also called Nemuel).

jamin.name: Jamin (Simeon's line)
jamin.bio: Son of Simeon, founder of the Jaminite clan.

ohad.name: Ohad
ohad.bio: Son of Simeon. His clan is not mentioned in later genealogies, suggesting it died out or was absorbed.

jachin.name: Jachin (Simeon's line)
jachin.bio: Son of Simeon, founder of the Jachinite clan (also called Jarib).

zohar.name: Zohar (Simeon's line)
zohar.bio: Son of Simeon, founder of the Zoharite clan (also called Zerah).

shaul.name: Shaul (Simeon's son)
shaul.bio: Son of Simeon by a Canaanite woman, founder of the Shaulite clan.

levi.name: Levi
levi.bio: Third son of Jacob by Leah. With Simeon, violently avenged Dinah's defilement, earning Jacob's curse of being scattered in Israel. However, God transformed this curse into blessing: the Levites became the priestly tribe, scattered among all Israel to teach God's law. Moses, Aaron, and Miriam descended from him. Levites received no territorial inheritance but were given cities throughout Israel. Lived 137 years.

gershon.name: Gershon
gershon.bio: Firstborn son of Levi. His descendants formed one of the three main Levitical clans, responsible for the tabernacle's coverings, curtains, and hangings. They camped west of the tabernacle.

libni.name: Libni
libni.bio: Son of Gershon, head of the Libnite clan among the Levites.

shimei_gershon.name: Shimei (Gershon's line)
shimei_gershon.bio: Son of Gershon, head of the Shimeite clan among the Levites. Distinct from other Shimeis in Scripture.

kohath.name: Kohath
kohath.bio: Second son of Levi, ancestor of Moses, Aaron, and the priestly line. His descendants were responsible for the most holy things of the tabernacle. They camped south of the tabernacle. Through Amram came Moses and Aaron. Lived 133 years. The Kohathites received 23 cities in Israel.

amram.name: Amram
amram.bio: Son of Kohath, married his aunt Jochebed. Father of Moses, Aaron, and Miriam—the three great leaders of the Exodus. Through him came both the priestly line (Aaron) and the prophetic leader who delivered Israel from Egypt (Moses). Lived 137 years.

aaron.name: Aaron
aaron.bio: Son of Amram and Jochebed, brother of Moses and Miriam. First high priest of Israel, from whom all legitimate priests descended. Spokesman for Moses before Pharaoh. His rod budded to confirm his priestly calling. Made the golden calf when Moses was on the mountain. His sons Nadab and Abihu died for offering unauthorized fire. Died on Mount Hor at age 123 after seeing the Promised Land but not entering due to striking the rock at Meribah.

nadab_aaron.name: Nadab (Aaron's son)
nadab_aaron.bio: Firstborn son of Aaron. He and his brother Abihu offered unauthorized fire before the LORD and were consumed by fire from God's presence on the same day they were ordained as priests. They had no children. Their deaths taught the holiness required in approaching God.

abihu.name: Abihu
abihu.bio: Second son of Aaron. With his brother Nadab, he died for offering unauthorized fire before the LORD. This occurred shortly after their ordination, serving as a severe warning about the holiness required in priestly service. They had no children.

eleazar.name: Eleazar
eleazar.bio: Third son of Aaron, married a daughter of Putiel. After his older brothers died, he became Aaron's successor as high priest. Helped Moses with the second census and assisted Joshua in dividing the Promised Land. Supervised the tabernacle and its holy objects. Father of Phinehas. The high priesthood continued through his line.

phinehas.name: Phinehas (Eleazar's son)
phinehas.bio: Son of Eleazar, grandson of Aaron. His name means 'bronze serpent' or 'Nubian.' Zealous for God's honor, he killed an Israelite man and Midianite woman during a plague, stopping God's wrath. God made a covenant of perpetual priesthood with him for his zeal. He served as high priest and was consulted about civil war with Benjamin. Lived to see Joshua's death.

abishua.name: Abishua
abishua.bio: Son of Phinehas, high priest. Part of the faithful priestly line through Eleazar and Phinehas.

bukki.name: Bukki
bukki.bio: Son of Abishua, high priest in the line from Aaron to Zadok.

uzzi_bukki.name: Uzzi (Bukki's line)
uzzi_bukki.bio: Son of Bukki, high priest. Distinct from other Uzzis in Scripture.

zerahiah.name: Zerahiah
zerahiah.bio: Son of Uzzi, high priest in the unbroken line to Zadok.

meraioth.name: Meraioth
meraioth.bio: Son of Zerahiah, high priest. Part of the genealogy recorded to establish Ezra's priestly credentials.

amariah_meraioth.name: Amariah (Meraioth's line)
amariah_meraioth.bio: Son of Meraioth, high priest in David's time.

ahitub.name: Ahitub (Amariah's son)
ahitub.bio: Son of Amariah, father of Zadok the high priest. Through him the priesthood was secured in David and Solomon's reign.

zadok.name: Zadok
zadok.bio: Son of Ahitub, high priest during David and Solomon's reigns. Remained faithful to David during Absalom's rebellion and supported Solomon against Adonijah. Anointed Solomon as king. God promised the priesthood would remain in his line. Ezekiel prophesied that Zadok's descendants would serve in the future temple. His name means 'righteous.'

ahimaaz.name: Ahimaaz
ahimaaz.bio: Son of Zadok. A swift runner who served as messenger for David during Absalom's rebellion. He and Jonathan (son of Abiathar) kept David informed of events in Jerusalem. He wanted to carry news of Absalom's death but was sent after a Cushite messenger.

azariah_ahimaaz.name: Azariah (Ahimaaz's line)
azariah_ahimaaz.bio: Son of Ahimaaz, high priest. Distinct from other Azariahs in the priestly line.

azariah_johanan.name: Azariah (Johanan's line)
azariah_johanan.bio: Son of Johanan, high priest who served in Solomon's temple. Possibly the same Azariah who opposed King Uzziah's unauthorized entry into the temple.

adam.name: Adam
adam.bio: First man, created by God from dust on the sixth day. Placed in the Garden of Eden to work and keep it. God created Eve from Adam's rib as his helper. They had dominion over all creation. Sinned by eating forbidden fruit, bringing death into the world. Expelled from Eden. Father of Cain, Abel, Seth, and other sons and daughters. Lived 930 years. His name means 'man' or 'red earth.' He is the head of the human race, as Christ is head of the new creation.

enos.name: Enos (Enosh)
enos.bio: Son of Seth, born when Seth was 105. His name means 'mortal' or 'frail man.' In his days men began to call upon the name of the LORD in a formal, public way. Father of Cainan. Lived 905 years.

cainan.name: Cainan (Kenan)
cainan.bio: Son of Enos, born when Enos was 90 years old. Father of Mahalaleel. Lived 910 years. Part of the godly line from Adam to Noah.

mahalaleel.name: Mahalaleel (Mahalalel)
mahalaleel.bio: Son of Cainan, born when Cainan was 70. His name means 'praise of God.' Father of Jared. Lived 895 years.

lamech_noah.name: Lamech (Noah's father)
lamech_noah.bio: Son of Methuselah, father of Noah. When Noah was born, Lamech prophesied that he would bring comfort concerning the ground God had cursed. Lived 777 years. Died five years before the Flood. Distinct from Lamech in Cain's line.

jesus.name: Jesus Christ
jesus.bio: Son of God, Son of Mary, legally son of Joseph. His name means 'The LORD saves.' Conceived by the Holy Spirit, born of the virgin Mary in Bethlehem, fulfilling prophecy. The eternal Word who became flesh. Fully God and fully man. Born under the Law, lived sinlessly. At 30, began public ministry. Preached the kingdom, performed miracles, called disciples. Betrayed by Judas, arrested, tried illegally, crucified under Pontius Pilate. Died for the sins of the world. Rose on the third day, appeared to many. Ascended to heaven, seated at God's right hand. He is Prophet, Priest, and King. The promised Messiah, Son of David, seed of Abraham. Second person of the Trinity. Savior of all who believe. He will return to judge the living and the dead and reign forever. He is the Alpha and Omega, beginning and end.

mary.name: Mary (Jesus' mother)
mary.bio: Mother of Jesus, wife of Joseph. From Nazareth, descendant of David. A virgin betrothed to Joseph when the angel Gabriel announced she would conceive by the Holy Spirit and bear the Son of God. She responded with faith: 'Behold the handmaid of the Lord.' Visited her cousin Elizabeth (pregnant with John the Baptist) and sang the Magnificat. Gave birth to Jesus in Bethlehem. Fled to Egypt with Joseph to escape Herod. Raised Jesus in Nazareth. At the wedding in Cana, she told the servants to do whatever Jesus said. She stood by the cross when Jesus died; He entrusted her to John's care. She was with the disciples after the ascension, praying in the upper room. Catholic and Orthodox traditions honor her highly, while Protestants recognize her faithful obedience. She had other children with Joseph after Jesus.

peter.name: Peter (Simon Peter)
peter.bio: Original name Simon, son of Jonah (John), brother of Andrew. From Bethsaida, a fisherman. Jesus named him Cephas (Peter) meaning 'rock.' One of the Twelve Apostles, part of Jesus' inner circle with James and John. Walked on water to Jesus. Confessed Jesus as 'the Christ, the Son of the living God'; Jesus said on this rock He would build His church. Witnessed the Transfiguration. Cut off the high priest's servant's ear. Denied Jesus three times but was restored. Preached at Pentecost; 3,000 saved. Led the early church. Vision of unclean animals led to accepting Gentiles. Confronted by Paul for hypocrisy regarding Gentiles. Wrote 1 and 2 Peter. Tradition says he was crucified upside down in Rome under Nero. Considered first pope by Catholics, though this is disputed by Protestants.

paul.name: Paul (Saul of Tarsus)
paul.bio: Originally Saul, from Tarsus in Cilicia. Tribe of Benjamin, Pharisee, studied under Gamaliel. Roman citizen. Zealously persecuted Christians, approving Stephen's stoning. On the road to Damascus, encountered the risen Christ; was blinded, then healed by Ananias. Called to be apostle to the Gentiles. After time in Arabia, began missionary journeys establishing churches throughout the Roman Empire. Wrote 13 (or 14) New Testament epistles. Imprisoned multiple times for the gospel. Appealed to Caesar as a Roman citizen; taken to Rome. Under house arrest, continued preaching. Tradition says he was beheaded in Rome under Nero. His theology profoundly shaped Christian doctrine on grace, faith, justification, the church, and Christ. Called himself the 'least of the apostles' and 'chief of sinners' yet ran his race with endurance.

john_apostle.name: John (the Apostle)
john_apostle.bio: Son of Zebedee, brother of James. From Galilee, a fisherman. One of the Twelve, part of Jesus' inner circle with Peter and James. Called 'sons of thunder' with his brother. The 'disciple whom Jesus loved' - reclined on Jesus' breast at the Last Supper. Witnessed the Transfiguration and Gethsemane. At the cross, Jesus entrusted Mary His mother to John's care. Ran to the tomb with Peter. After Pentecost, served with Peter in Jerusalem. Wrote the Gospel of John, 1-3 John, and Revelation. Exiled to Patmos where he received the Revelation. Tradition says he was the only apostle not martyred, living to old age in Ephesus. His writings emphasize love, light, truth, and the deity of Christ. Called himself 'the elder.'

james_apostle.name: James (the Apostle, son of Zebedee)
james_apostle.bio: Son of Zebedee, brother of John. From Galilee, a fisherman. One of the Twelve, part of Jesus' inner circle with Peter and John. With John, called 'sons of thunder' - they wanted to call down fire on a Samaritan village. Witnessed the Transfiguration, the raising of Jairus' daughter, and Gethsemane. The first apostle martyred - Herod Agrippa I had him killed with the sword circa AD 44. Distinct from James the Lord's brother and James son of Alphaeus.

james_lords_brother.name: James (the Lord's brother)
james_lords_brother.bio: Brother (or half-brother) of Jesus, son of Mary and Joseph. Did not believe in Jesus during His ministry. After the resurrection, Jesus appeared to him specifically. Became a leader of the Jerusalem church. At the Jerusalem Council, he spoke decisively about Gentile believers. Paul called him a 'pillar' of the church. Wrote the Epistle of James, emphasizing faith shown by works. Tradition says he was known as 'James the Just' for his righteousness and prayer life. According to Josephus and tradition, he was martyred by being thrown from the temple pinnacle, then stoned, circa AD 62. Distinct from James son of Zebedee and James son of Alphaeus.

jude.name: Jude (Judas, the Lord's brother)
jude.bio: Brother (or half-brother) of Jesus and James, son of Mary and Joseph. Called Judas, but distinguished from Judas Iscariot. One of the Twelve (also called Thaddaeus or Lebbaeus). Did not believe in Jesus during His ministry but was converted after the resurrection. Wrote the Epistle of Jude, warning against false teachers and contending for the faith. Quotes from Enoch and possibly the Assumption of Moses. Begins his epistle calling himself 'servant of Jesus Christ and brother of James' rather than claiming to be Jesus' brother. Tradition says he preached in various regions and was martyred, possibly with Simon the Zealot.
